passages.name: 01 Begin
passages.content:
--- Chapter 1: The Hero's Departure ---
Her teeth catch my shoulder through sweat and morning light. That's how I know Elara's already awake - she always bites when she wants something.

"Going somewhere, hero?" Her voice drips honey and mischief. Auburn hair spills across our sheets like spilled wine, and those sapphire eyes of hers - they'd make a lesser man forget his own name. Fortune favors meâ€”I've never been lesser.

Image: My darling wife!
Outside, Eboncrest groans awake. Cart wheels on cobblestone, the baker's daughter cursing at flour sacks, old Henrik arguing with his mule about the meaning of forward. My town. My people. But right now, my wife's got her thigh hooked over mine and her fingers tracing the scar where that wyvern nearly took my liver three summers back.

"Mayor wants me at the west gate by second bell," I tell her, but my hands are already contradicting my words, tracing each knob of her spine, down to where her waist kicks out into those hips. Hips that have ruined better men than me.

"Second bell." She grins, wicked as a blade. "That's ages from now."

Dawn's barely cracked. The bedroom still holds night's chill, but Elara's skin burns fever-hot against mine. Always does. Like she swallowed dawn whole and keeps it burning somewhere beneath that freckled flesh.

"You're thinking with your sword again," she teases, grinding against me just enough to prove her point.

"Both of them, apparently."

That earns me a laughâ€”full-bodied, belly-deep, the sort that vibrates through both of us. Elara. Six years wed and she still unravels me like I'm some green boy seeing his first pair ofâ€”

She rolls on top of me. The full weight of her settles across my hipsâ€”warm thighs squeezing, tits swaying heavy as she adjusts, nipples dragging across my chest. Morning light catches the copper in her hair and she looks like something men start wars over. She rolls her hips in slow circles, grinding down, and every thought I've ever had turns to soupâ€”

"Focus, sold

passages.name: 01 Elara
passages.content:
I flip her like she weighs nothing.

"Think you're in charge?" My voice comes out rougher than intended.

She tries to wiggle free, laughing, but I pin both her wrists with one hand. The other yanks her nightgown up, bunching white linen around her waist. That perfect peach of an ass exposed in morning light - pale as cream, soft as sin.

"Someone's feeling brave this morâ€”"

**CRACK.** My palm meets her ass, the sound echoing off our bedroom walls.

"Aldric!" But she's already pushing back, wanting more.

"That's 'sir' when I've got you bent over." Another spank, harder. Her flesh jiggles, turns pink under my hand. "Or would you prefer the whole street knows what we're doing?"

"Like they don't alreadyâ€”ah!"

I grab a fistful of auburn hair, pull her up on all fours. "They're about to know exactly how Aldric the Great breeds his woman."

One thrust and I'm buried to the hilt. She's soakedâ€”been ready since she woke, the greedy thingâ€”and so tight I have to lock my jaw to keep from finishing right there. We both groan.

"Fuck! Warn a girl before youâ€”"

"Before I what?" I pull almost all the way out, slam back home. "Before I take what's mine?"

The bed frame bangs against the wall. Good. Let every gossip in Eboncrest know I'm putting a baby in my wife before I go kill their monsters.

"Flux take meâ€”nghâ€”you're insatiable!"

"You *love* being taken like a tavern wench." I reach aroundâ€”her clit swollen and ready.

"I'm yourâ€”*ah!*â€”your wife, you *brute*!"

"My wife who's about to scream loud enough to wake the baker."

I stop holding back. Each thrust drives her forward on the sheets, and her asscheeks ripple and clap against my hipsâ€”**PLAP PLAP PLAP**â€”the wet, meaty sound of a woman getting properly fucked. Her back arches deeper, showing me everything, and she's so wet it's running down her thighs.

"Go on, love. Let them hear you."

passages.name: 01 Comfort
passages.content:
Image: She's got something running down her leg... wonder who did that!
"Just weeding the stone garden, love." I tear into a honey cake, still hot enough to burn my fingers. Worth it. "Just plucking weeds before they choke the crop."

She sets down a mug of bark tea with more force than necessary. "That's what you said about the cockatrice."

"The cockatrice barely nicked me."

"You came home with half your chest hanging open!"

I catch her wrist, gentle. "That was two years ago. And I learned my lesson about checking corners."

"Did you?" She's not really angry. Just worried. I can read it in how she keeps touching things - the table, her locket, the bread knife. "Because Giles offered to go with you. Said so yesterday at market."

"Giles." I snort. "Good man with a sword, but Goblins don't give a thrack about swords. They care about fire. Wind. The kind of forces that make them remember why they used to fear humans."

"They *used* to fear us?"

"Before they learned we're soft." I pull her onto my lap. She resists for half a heartbeat, then melts against me. "That's why they're getting bold. Coming out of the eastern wastes, sniffing around our borders. Testing."

"Testing for what?"

I don't answer that. Don't tell her about the patterns I've been noticing. She's got enough to worry about.

"You're doing that thing," she says against my shoulder.

"What thing?"

"That thing where you go quiet because you think I can't handle the truth."

Six years and she reads me like one of her garden almanacs.

"The *truth* is," I say carefully, "twelve goblins in a mine is nothing. The truth is I've cleared three times that many from tighter spaces. The truth isâ€”"

Video

"The truth is you're going alone." She pulls back, pins me with that drowning-deep stare. "Again."

"Someone has to stay and protect the town."

"From what? Mean old Mrs. Curdsworth and her attack chickens?"

That makes me laugh. "Those chickens *are* vicious."

She doesn't smile. "Train more knights, Aldric.

passages.name: 01 mayor
passages.content:
Image: Eboncrest rises where the Pitchwater meets pine.
Mayor Bramble finds me at the west gate, already sweating through his doublet. But the man keeps Eboncrest running smooth as dwarf-forged steel, and that counts for something.

"Aldric." He's breathing hard from the walk. Probably came straight from his morning ledgers. "Thank the Ephemerals you're here."

"Mayor." I adjust Whisperwind's weight at my side. The guards at the gate give us space, but they're listening.

"The situation at Ironrockâ€”" He mops his forehead with a silk kerchief that costs more than most miners see in a month. "We've had to halt all operations. That's three days of ore we're not pulling. The smelters are sitting idle. The whole supply chain to the capital..."

The driver, old Henrik's boy, tips his cap to me. I nod back. Kid lost two fingers to a wyvern last harvestâ€”still drives better than his father.

"How many men did you lose?" I ask.

"None dead, Flux be praised. But seven injured in the retreat. They say the goblins have built *something* down there. Barricades. Maybe worse." His jowls quiver with each word. "The miners, they're talking about... structures. Old stonework they broke through last week."

My spine straightens. "Stonework?"

"Old things. Carvings. The kind the scholars in Thuulk pay gold for." He drops his voice.

A kid kicks a leather ball past us, chasing chickens.

"The goblins found it first?"

"Seems so. Moved right in once our boys broke through." Bramble pulls a scroll from his vest. "The mine foreman drew this. What they could see before they ran."

I study the rough sketch. Pillars. Arched doorways too tall for dwarves, too ornate for early human work. My jaw tightens.

"I'll clear them out," I tell him. "Send the miners back tomorrow morning with a double guard shift."

"Tomorrow? Aldric, there could be dozensâ€”"

"There aren't." I hand back the scroll. "Dozen, maybe fifteen at most. Goblins can't think past their next meal. They find a hole, they squat in it

passages.name: 01 leave for ironrock
passages.content:
The King's Road carries me west through morning mist. Pine needles crunch under my boots, that sharp green smell mixing with damp earth. The forest here grows thickâ€”old growth that remembers when goblins were just bad dreams told to children.

Three miners trudge toward me, pulling a handcart loaded with personal effects. Walking with the slow certainty of men who'd seen enough.

"Morning, Aldric." The lead miner, Henrik's cousin by his jaw, doesn't quite meet my eyes. "Figured we'd see you coming."

"How many?" I ask.

"Can't say for certain." He spits tobacco juice into the ferns. "Enough. They came up through the new shaft we broke last sennight. The one with the old stonework."

"Anyone hurt?"

"Not our team. Bruises. Pride, mostly. We locked the upper galleries and got out clean." He shifts the cart handles. "They're... settling in. Like they plan to stay."

I nod. "Mine'll be clear by sunset. Tell Bramble to send the next shift at dawn."

They continue west. I continue east. The forest knows what's comingâ€”birds gone quiet, even the insects holding their breath.

Fresh wheel ruts cut deep in mud. Someone left in a hurryâ€”probably with a full load, too.

Then I smell it.

Goblin stench hits like a wall. Unwashed bodies layered over something worseâ€”the musk of things that rut in darkness and eat their own dead. My gorge rises. I breathe through my mouth, but that's worse. Now I can taste it.

The path opens into the mine's staging area. Abandoned equipment everywhereâ€”pickaxes dropped mid-swing, lunch pails still steaming, a card game interrupted, copper coins scattered across a crate. They didn't run. They just... left. Orderly. Like they knew exactly what not to fight.

Dark stains on the ground near the entrance. Goblin marking fluidâ€”acrid, territorial. They're claiming territory. My jaw clenches thinking of what that means. In the frontier villages, girls disappear. Not killedâ€”worse. Kept. Bred. Some get rescued sennights later, hollow-eyed and babbling. Some g

passages.name: 01 mine
passages.content:
The darkness swallows me whole.

Mine air lands heavy in the chestâ€”thick, wet, with weight behind it. My eyes adjust slow. The entrance tunnel slopes down, support beams every ten feet. Some are cracked. Some are missing. The floor's uneven where cart tracks cut grooves decades deep.

Whisperwind slides from her sheath. The faint scrape of steel on leather sounds loud as thunder down here. I keep the blade low, ready for the upward cut that opens goblin throats.

Right hand on the wall. Always keep contact in the dark. The stone sweatsâ€”groundwater seeping through limestone. My fingers trace tool marks, then something else. Scratches. Fresh. Goblin claws marking territory like dogs pissing on posts.

I test each plank before trusting my weight. Second rule of mine fighting: the ground lies. Goblins love pit traps, love watching men fall onto stakes smeared with their shit. The wood groans but holds.

Deeper now. The stench thickensâ€”unwashed bodies, rotting meat, and underneath it all, that sweet-sick musk. My stomach clenches.

Thereâ€”a broken helmet in the muck. Not dropped. Crushed. Tooth marks punch through the iron like it's parchment. Whatever bit through this wasn't satisfied with just killing.

The tunnel branches ahead. I can hear them nowâ€”that chittering speech that sounds like someone choking on their own tongue. At least three voices. Maybe five. They're not trying to hide. Why would they? This is their domain now.

I drop to one knee, scoop a handful of pebbles. Whisper the word that wakes wind.

"Ventusfury."

Just a breath of magic, enough to carry the pebbles' rattle down the left passage. The chittering stops.

Good.

The main passage opens into a wider chamber ahead. I can make out their shapesâ€”three goblins arranged in a loose picket line. The other two have rusty mining picks, probably pulled from dead men's hands. They're focused on the side passage where my pebbles landed.

The dance begins.

]Magic. Scholars view it as a conversation; I view it a

passages.name: 01 combat
passages.content:
The cross-brace hangs lowâ€”meant for mining carts, not men. I slide beneath it, spine scraping wood, Whisperwind reversed in my grip.

The first goblin never sees me coming.

My pommel strikes the soft spot where skull meets spine. The crack is wet, muffled. He drops like a sack of grain. I catch him before he hits ground, lower him silent into the muck. His sling stones scatterâ€”I palm three.

The second goblin starts to turn. I'm already moving.

Whisperwind knows this dance. The blade shifts in my handâ€”a living thing that remembers every fight we've shared. I bring her up in a reversed grip, the false edge finding the sweet spot under his jaw. The cut is clean, surgical. He tries to scream but I've already opened his windpipe. Just a wheeze and he's down, drowning in his own blood.

The third one sees his partner fall.

"Ventusfury," I breathe.

The slinger's raising his weapon. My wind pushes his elbow just as he releasesâ€”the stone meant for my skull cracks into the ceiling instead. He's fumbling for another stone when Whisperwind's point catches his heart.

Three heartbeats. Three corpses.

I wipe the blade clean on the slinger's rags. That's when I see themâ€”human eyes threaded on gut-string like a necklace. Still wet. Still warm. The irises are blue.

Deeper in, I hear shuffling. Careful movement. They know something's wrong but not what.

Let the wondering gnaw them hollow.

The tunnel narrows ahead, then opens into what must have been the overseer's station. I can see lamplight bleeding around a doorframe. They're falling back, trying to fortify.

> Advance on the barricaded office.]The ore wedge sits loose against the wallâ€”a triangular chunk of iron meant to split rock. My boot sends it clattering loud as thunder.

All three goblins turn toward the sound.

I'm already moving the opposite direction. Three long strides right, making sure my boots ring against stone. The slinger tracks the sound, arm drawing back. The two with picks start forward.

Then I cut le

passages.name: 01 barricade
passages.content:
[Image: The door's solid oak reinforcedâ€”meant to protect payroll from desperate miners.
I can hear them inside. Furniture scraping. Bottles clinking. They're building a barricade, but they're also preparing something else. The smell of lamp oil cuts through the usual goblin stench.

The office overlooks the main shaft through a narrow window. Smart defensive positionâ€”if I hadn't fought in a hundred rat's nests just like it.

They've stacked desks against the door. Through the gap beneath, I see shadows moving. Four, maybe five. Two near the back are doing something with clay jugs. Oil bombs.

Typical goblin tacticsâ€”when you can't win clean, burn everything.

The door won't budge. They've braced it well.Video

"Ventusfury!"

I don't whisper it this time. I roar it.

Wind explodes from my palmsâ€”a hammering gale that hits the door like a giant's fist. The wood splinters. Iron bands buckle. The entire frame tears free from the stone, crashing outward and bringing the desk-barricade with it.

I'm through before the dust settles.

The room's smaller than expectedâ€”fifteen feet square, ceiling sagging with timber rot. An oil lamp swings from a chain, casting wild shadows. Two goblins with jugs of oil stand frozen by the back wall. Three others scramble over the destroyed furniture, reaching for weapons.

Whisperwind takes the first one across the eyes. The blade moves like thoughtâ€”no hesitation between decision and action. Blood sprays across yellowed invoices still tacked to the wall.

I let him swing. At the last second, I step inside his reach, catch his wrist with my free hand. My knee drives into his elbowâ€”the joint bends backward with a crack like breaking kindling. While he screams, Whisperwind opens his throat.

The oil-throwers are recovering. One's got a burning rag ready.

"Glacieshold!"

Ice erupts across the floor, racing up their legs, freezing the oil in their jugs solid. The one with the burning rag drops it in panic. The flame hits the ice, sputters out.

T

passages.name: 01 shaft
passages.content:
The main shaft opens before me like a throat.

The hoist mechanism dominates the spaceâ€”massive wooden wheels and hemp ropes thick as my arm. The cage hangs halfway down, swaying slightly. Below it, lit by goblin torches, I see what the miners found.

They broke through into something ancient. The stone down there is differentâ€”black, polished, carved with symbols that squirm when you stare too long. K'tarran. Has to be.

A dozen goblins cluster around the breakthrough. One wears a headdress of human teeth and finger bonesâ€”their shaman. He's drumming on a shield, the rhythm matching something deeper, older. The stones themselves seem to pulse with it.

Between them and me: forty feet of vertical shaft and a half-lowered cage.

Time to remind them why humans conquered this world.

I grab the hoist rope, wrap it around my waist. Then I cut the brake.

The cage plummets. I plummet with it, controlling my descent just enough not to die. The goblins shriek, scatter. Twenty feet. Ten feet. Fiveâ€”

I let go.

Landing hard, I roll forward, come up with Whisperwind already moving. The blade takes the closest goblin across the belly. His guts spill onto stone older than kingdoms.

Image: Another debt paid in the dark.

"Ventusfury!"

Wind explodes outward, sending three goblins tumbling. One goes over the edge into the shaftâ€”his scream echoes all the way down.

The shaman keeps drumming, faster now. The carved stones glow brighter.

Two goblins with shields block my path. They move together, trained. I feint left, they track. I go right, they're ready.

Fine.

Battle

passages.name: 01 combat minigame
passages.content:
"Glacieshold!"

Ice spreads beneath their feet. They slip, shields dropping just an inch. Enough. Whisperwind threads the gap, opens the first one's throat. I shoulder-check the second, send him sliding across the ice into the wall. His skull cracks against stone.

The shaman's drumming reaches crescendo. The carved archway behind him starts to hum.

No more time for clean kills.

"Ignisurge!"

Fire erupts from both handsâ€”a roaring wave that washes over the remaining goblins. They scatter, burning, screaming. The shaman tries to maintain his rhythm but his headdress catches fire. He drops the drum, rolling on the ground.

I walk through the flames.

Too fast.

The ice I laidâ€”my own iceâ€”has melted in rivulets where the fire washed across it. The stone beneath shines wet, black, treacherous. My boot finds the slick and for one terrible instant I am not Aldric the Great, hero of Eboncrest, slayer of wyverns and trolls. I am simply a body obeying gravity.

My ankle rolls. Not badlyâ€”I've fought through worseâ€”but it costs me half a heartbeat. My weight shifts wrong. Whisperwind's arc falters mid-swing, her tip catching stone instead of goblin flesh, and the impact judders up through my wrist.

The goblin I meant to kill does not die.

He is small. Barely three feet, green as pond-scum, eyes like diseased egg-yolks. His pick is rusted iron that wouldn't cut cheese. He smells of piss and rotting meat and that sweet-sick musk that makes my stomach clench.

He does not swing at my chest or throat. A warrior would. A soldier would.

He swings at my knee.

The pick-point punches through the gap in my greave where the joint flexes. Not deepâ€”barely an inch of corroded metal in the meat behind my kneecapâ€”but the leg buckles. I go down on that knee, Whisperwind scraping sparks from stone, and the world narrows to a single point of white-hot wrongness where my body has been breached.

"GRASHK!" The goblin screams it like triumph. "GRASHK-THRACK! DOWN! DOWN!"

I bring Whisperwind aro

passages.name: 01 die
passages.content:
They take their time.

This is what I learn in the space between living and dying: goblins are patient when the outcome is assured. They are not berserkers drunk on violence. They are scavengers, carrion-feeders, and they have learned across a thousand generations that thrashing prey injures scavengers. So they wait and let me bleed.

The shaman crouches just out of reach, Whisperwind laid across his knees like a trophy. He strokes her blade with his good hand, leaving smears of green-black blood on skyforged steel. "Pretty," he murmurs. "Pretty-sharp. Cut-cut-cut all the Grikzit boys."

"Grikzit," I repeat. The word comes out wrong, bubbled through something wet in my throat. "That's your tribe."

"Grikzit strongest." He shows his teeth. They are filed to points, stained yellow-brown, and several are missing.

I try to wipe it away. My arms don't want to cooperate. One of the goblinsâ€”I've stopped tracking which is whichâ€”has tied my wrists behind my back with a leather cord that might be human skin. The binding isn't tight. It doesn't need to be. I cannot rise.

"Twelve Grikzit this morning," the shaman continues. "Twelve. Now four. Four and Grubnoz." He taps his chest. "Grubnoz. Remember name, fire-man. Grubnoz the one who kills Aldric the Great."

"Grubnoz," I manage. "Let's... negotiate."

The goblins cackle, high-pitched and wet, slapping their thighs with hands still crusted in their brothers' blood. One of them laughs so hard he falls over.

"Negotiate," Grubnoz repeats, savoring the word. "Fire-man wants to negotiate. What fire-man got to trade? Shinies?" He reaches down, fumbles at my belt, finds my purse. Empties it. The coins scatter across black stone, winking in the torchlight. "Got these already."

"More," I say. "My house. Eboncrest. I'm rich."

"Rich." Grubnoz tilts his head, considering. "Rich in humie-town. Town with walls. Town with guards." He shakes his head sadly. "Grubnoz not go to humie-town. Grubnoz stay here. Stay in dark. Safe in dark."

"T

passages.name: 01 ruins
passages.content:
Image: Pillars thick as ancient oaks march in rows, disappearing into darkness my torch can't pierce.

The temperature drops twenty degrees the moment I cross through.

My breath mists. Carved blocks of stone, each one larger than a house, fitted so tight a razor couldn't find the seam. No mortar. No need.

The floor slopes down into a vast chamber. The stone is the same black material, but here it's carved with shapesâ€”suggestions of things that shouldn't existâ€”too many eyes, angles that fold back on themselves, mouths where mouths shouldn't be.

The air tastes of copper and old death. Older than rot. The exhalation of tombs sealed before men scratched their first words in clay.

Movement in the shadows. Three goblins crouch near a collapsed section of wall, pawing through rubble. They haven't seen me yet. One's massiveâ€”squat, all muscle and gut, cock swinging free and slapping his thigh with each step. The thing's as long as my forearm and leaking. Goblins.

The big one finds somethingâ€”a tarnished amulet. He bites it, testing for gold.

> Attack them.

passages.name: 01 pursue
passages.content:
I drop from the elevated entrance, fifteen feet straight down.

The first goblin looks up just as my boots crush his ribcage. Bones snap like dry branches. His eyes bulge, blood frothing from his mouth. I roll forward off his corpse, Whisperwind already singing.

The second goblin fumbles for a rusty blade.

"Ignisurge!"

Fire erupts point-blank into his face. His skull goes up like a pitch-soaked rag. He runs three steps, four, then collapses. The smell of burning meat and hair fills the chamber.

The big oneâ€”he's already moving. Not toward me, but away, surprisingly fast for something carrying that much meat between its legs. He vaults over a low wall, that obscene appendage flopping wildly.

I pursue.

The chamber opens into what must have been a plaza. A dry fountain dominates the center, its basin filled with bones so old they've gone to powder. Stone benches ring the space. Buildingsâ€”or what's left of themâ€”rise on all sides, their doorways gaping like mouths.

The goblin scrambles up a wide staircase carved into the chamber wall. I follow, taking the steps three at a time.

"Ventusfury!"

Wind howls up the stairwell, meant to knock him down. He ducks into an alcove at the last second. My wind tears past, accomplishing nothing but stirring tomb-dust.

"Clever little shit," I mutter.

He's running again, that massive cock bouncing off his thighs with each step. How does he even move that fast? The stairs spiral up along the chamber wall. Fifty feet. Seventy. A hundred. My legs burn but I keep climbing.

The stairs end at a bridgeâ€”narrow, no rails, spanning a chasm I can't see the bottom of. The goblin's halfway across, arms out for balance.

"Glacieshold!"

Ice races across the bridge. The goblin sees it coming, leaps for the far side. His fingers catch the edge. That ridiculous member swings like a pendulum as he dangles.

I charge across the ice-slicked bridge. He's pulling himself up. My sword comes downâ€”

He lets go.

The bastard lets go, dropping onto a hid

passages.name: 01 collar
passages.content:
The passage opens into what can only be a temple.

The ceiling vanishes into darkness. Carved figures cover every surfaceâ€”things that demanded worship. Many-eyed things. Things with too many mouths. The same nightmare geometry from the pillars, but more deliberate here. More focused.

An altar dominates the far end, black stone stained darker with old blood. The goblin scrambles over it, knocking aside pottery shards and rusted implements.

Behind the altar, partially buried in rubble: a metal chest. The lock's already broken, lid hanging open.

"Ignisurge!"

My fireball explodes against the altar. Stone chips fly. The goblin yelps, dives behind the chest.

I advance, Whisperwind ready. He's trapped now. Nowhere left to run.

That's when I see what he's holding.

It's a collarâ€”iron, but wrong somehow. The metal seems to drink light rather than reflect it. Symbols writhe across its surface, similar to the wall carvings but smaller, more concentrated. Just looking at it makes my teeth ache.

The goblin holds it like a shield, eyes wide with terror. His cock has finally shrunk back, fear overwhelming even goblin biology.

"Drop it," I command.

He throws it at me.

Clumsy with terror. Awkward and wild. I sidestep easily, butâ€”

The collar hits Whisperwind.

The sword screamsâ€”a sound no steel should make, a shriek from somewhere deeper than metal. The blade jerks in my hand like a living thing trying to flee.

The collar bounces off, lands on the stone between us. We both stare at it.

The goblin moves first, scrambling to grab it again. I lunge forward, boot coming down where his hand would be. He jerks back. I swing Whisperwind in a killing arcâ€”

The collar springs open.

No one touched it. It just... opens. A mouth made of hunger.

Dark energy bleeds from itâ€”visible, black, alive. It ignores the goblin entirely and lunges for me.

Whisperwind comes up. The darkness splits around the blade and reforms behind it, tightening like a noose.

The collar hits my palm an inch

passages.name: 02 Wake up
passages.content:
--- Chapter 2: The Collar ---
The dream tears at me like wolves.

Elara's in our bed, but something's wrongâ€”her belly swells with child, but when she turns to me, her eyes are yellow. Goblin yellow. She opens her mouth to speak and that chittering language spills out, wet and wrong. I try to scream but my voice comes out in the same foul tongueâ€”

Video

Cold stone slaps me awake.

My skull throbs. Each heartbeat hammers against bone like a smith working iron. The taste of copper coats my throat. Where... the mine. The ruins. That green bastard with the collarâ€”

I try to sit up.

Weight drags at my ribs. Two masses of flesh, heavy as saddlebags, pulling me forward before I've finished moving. They swing when I stopâ€”a sickening delay, like carrying something alive that doesn't know I've changed direction.

My hand goes to check for wounds and sinks knuckle-deep into warm, yielding meat that overflows my grip.

Growing from my chest. Part of me.

Each gasp lifts them against my fingers and drops them againâ€”warm dough that won't stop moving. Metal scales bite crescents into skin so tender my jaw locks. Cold air finds my stomach, my ribs, acres of bare skin where mail and leather should be.

I force myself upright. The titsâ€”call them what they areâ€”lurch forward with my momentum, then rebound against my ribs hard enough to make me gag. I pitch forward like a ship taking on water. My hands shoot out and I see them in the cave-moss glow.

Hands like a noblewoman'sâ€”tapered fingers without a single callus, smooth as if they'd never gripped anything heavier than embroidery silk.

Image: No. No no no.

Hair falls across my visionâ€”a black curtain that wasn't there this morning. I shake my head and feel the weight of it sweep past my shoulder blades, clinging to sweat-damp skin all the way to my waist.

I look down.

Two obscene mounds strain against metal triangles that wouldn't cover a man's palm. These hands are smaller. Everything is smaller except what hangs from my chest. T

passages.name: 02 finding out
passages.content:
I plant my palms on cold stone and push.

My legs straighten and the boots pitch me onto metal spikes where heels should be. My calves seize instantlyâ€”tendons stretched to snapping, ankles wobbling on points no wider than arrow-tips. The tits launch forward before I've finished standing, dragging my whole center of gravity with them. I windmill backward but the boots won't let me plant my feet flat. They force everything into a curve: chest forward, spine arched, ass thrust back, the whole body arranged around a pair of metal stakes and the desperate wish not to fall.

My thighs press togetherâ€”soft as bread dough, sliding against each other with a friction that shouldn't exist. Fat thighs. Woman's thighs that kiss when I walk. The metal strap between my legs rides up, cutting into places thatâ€”

"See, yer fancy gods..." His voice drops to something almost philosophicalâ€”the collar's gift of intelligence turning crude into cruel. "Storak don't want none of that thrakkin' stuff they want. Storak just wants SEED in CUNTS. And ye know what?"

He pauses. The silence begs for someone to fill it.

"Storak WINS. Every time. 'Cause thinkin' and choosin'... that takes EFFORT. Bodies do what bodies DO. Yer wife's body..." He trails off meaningfully. "Well. She knows what I mean, don't she?"

I feel her flinch.

"G'night, titcow. G'night, missus." The sounds of him settling. Then, almost as an afterthought: "Twenty-nine days left. Plenty of time for PRAYER."

Elara's hand gropes through the dark and locks around mine. Fierce. Desperate.

"I love you," she whispers.

The words sound different t

passages.name: 04 day3 grooming
passages.content:
The curry comb is a sorry thingâ€”a flat stone.

I drag it down Jarkrond's flank for the hundredth time.

"This is absurd," I mutter to no one. The ash-runner's grey hide ripples beneath the stone's passage, muscle shifting under skin like snakes beneath silk. "As if you give a damn about your *appearance*. You live around thrakking *goblins*."

Jarkrond's ear swivels toward me. Those amber eyes track my reflection in the well-water.

Behind me, the hut squats against its dead tree. Smoke curls from the chimney hole. Elara is in there. With *him*.

My jaw tightens.

*You do the hunting, hero-cunt. Missus does the cooking. You groom Jarko. Missus mends the roof-thatch. You haul water. Missusâ€”*

Always *missus*. Always Elara, alone with him, while I'm sent to the far corners of his miserable territory.

The wool of my breeches clings to my thighs, damp with sweat. The cotton blouseâ€”*real clothes*, thank the Triadâ€”has gone translucent where it plasters against my chest, the fabric darkening in a V between my breasts. I can feel the moisture pooling in the hollow of my collarbone, trickling down to disappear into the valley of my cleavage.

This body *sweats*. Profusely. Constantly. As if designed to glisten.

I drag the comb down Jarkrond's barrel, working the dust from his coat in long strokes. His hide is fever-warm beneath my touch, radiating heat like sun-baked stone. When I lean close to reach his withers, something *thick* fills my nostrils.

It's... salty. Grassy, but also deeper. Like copper left too long in summer rain.

I jerk my head back.

*Focus. Just finish this and get back to her.*

"Ye missin' a spot, cow-tits."

I don't turn around.

"Go away, Snib," I manage. The collar permits it, as it shares my master's amusement.

"Awww, and here I thought ye'd be GRATEFUL." His shadow falls across my work, three feet of it grotesquely elongated by the sun. "Givin' ye a break from the HARD labor. Lettin' ye spend time with Jarko here."

"Where's Elara?"

"Busy." Th

passages.name: 04 grope
passages.content:
I don't give him the satisfaction of a reaction.

"Ye know what I like about ye, hero-cunt?"

I don't answer. Don't engage.

"YER ARSE."

His hand *cracks* against my backside without warningâ€”a full-armed swing that sends my body lurching forward, my palms slapping against Jarkrond's flank for balance. ]I turnâ€”

â€”and his warty hand *cracks* across my ass before I can register the movement.

"Look at THAT!" Snib cackles, and I feel his stubby fingers grip a handful of my ass through the fabric. He *kneads* it like bread dough, his claws pricking through the wool. "Ye could bounce a gold piece off that, ye could! Too bad ye don't got enough..."

The collar vibrates against my throat.

Jarkrond's head swings around. Those amber eyes find Snib's hand on my body.

"Oi, JARKYSKINS." Snib releases me with a final *squeeze* and waddles around to face the stallion. He jabs a stubby finger at the horse's muzzle. "Don't ye go gettin' IDEAS, boy. This arseâ€”" He gestures back at me. "â€”belongs to SNIB. These titsâ€”" Another gesture. "â€”belong to SNIB. This whole bouncy, jiggly, hero-shaped FUCKTOY belongs to SNIB."

Jarkrond's nostrils flare.

"UNLESSâ€”" Snib's broken-toothed grin spreads. "â€”unless ye ask REAL nice. Then maybeâ€”MAYBEâ€”I might let ye have a turn."

He cackles at his own joke and waddles back toward the hut.

"Keep brushin', titcow! Says 'e wants to be GLEAMING!"

The hide-flap swallows him.

I stand there, my ass still stinging from the impact, and stare at the smoke rising from the chimney.

*Elara.*

The curry comb feels heavy in my hand.> Continue grooming.

passages.name: 04 underbelly
passages.content:
I circle to Jarkrond's other side.

His near flank is doneâ€”grey hide gleaming dully in the afternoon light, free of the dust that accumulates in these endless sands. Now the far side. Then his legs. Then hisâ€”

*Underbelly*.

I hesitate.

Horses need their underbellies groomed like any other part. Aldric did this a hundred times with war-mounts. It's nothing. It's *routine*.

I crouch beside him, the worn stone warm in my palm, and begin working the dust from his barrel where it curves beneath his chest.

The scent is stronger here. Each stroke of the comb releases more of it from his hideâ€”that thick, *living* smell that seems to bypass my nose entirely and settle directly into the base of my skull. My nipples stiffen against the damp cotton of my blouse before I can stop them, two points of sensation I didn't ask for, don't want, can't seem to control.

*It's just a horse. It's just GROOMING. This body reacts to everything.*

I work the comb lower, into the shadow of his belly, the sensitive skin where forelegs meet trunk.

I freeze.

From his sheathâ€”that sweat-darkened leather pouch slung between his hindlegsâ€”the beast is emerging. Pink-grey and glistening, mottled with darker patches where blood pulses beneath the surface. It slides out inch by inch, wet and heavy and *thick*, until it hangs there, half-erect, swinging gently with the rhythm of his heartbeat.

The head alone is larger than my fist, flared and blunt and weeping something clear that catches the light before dripping onto the sand.

Image: right
I should look away.

I should *definitely* look away.

But my eyes are fixed on itâ€”on the way the veins pulse beneath the mottled skin, on the way the heat radiates off it in visible waves, on the way it *twitches* as if aware of my attention.

Jarkrond's head turns. Those amber eyes pin me where I crouch.

passages.name: 04 brush choice
passages.content:
*Horses drop when they're relaxed. It means nothing. It's NOTHING.*

I force my eyes back to the comb. To his hide. To the *task*.

My strokes are shorter now. Quicker. I'm working around the area, avoiding theâ€”the *thing* swinging in my peripheral vision, but I'm still *working*. Just doing what Snib ordered.

This is just grooming. This is just a horse being a horse. This body reacts to *everything*, and that doesn't mean anything, and the fact that my thighs are pressing together of their own accord is justâ€”justâ€”

I finish his sides. Move to his legs. Keep my head down.

When I finally back away, Jarkrond's cock is *fully* erect nowâ€”curved upward against his belly, the head kissing his own grey hide, leaving a wet smear of something that glistens in the sun.

He watches me walk back toward the hut.]I scramble backward.

The curry comb tumbles from my fingers into the sand. My heel catches on a buried root and I nearly fall, catching myself on the well.

"I'mâ€”" The word comes out strange. "I'm done. You're... you're groomed enough."

Jarkrond makes a sound.

His cock twitches onceâ€”twiceâ€”then begins the slow process of retreating into its sheath. The wet *schlurp* of its withdrawal follows me as I turn and walkâ€”*don't run, don't RUN*â€”toward the hut.

I don't look back.

But I feel his eyes on me the whole way.> Go back inside.

passages.name: 04 go inside
passages.content:
The hide-flap parts under my hand.

Inside, Elara looks up from the cookfire with a smile that doesn't quite reach her eyes.

"You're back early," she says.

Snib, sprawled on his fur pile, just grins.> Evening falls...

passages.name: 04 day3 evening
passages.content:
"Hold still."

Elara's fingers are gentle on my forearm, wrapping the linen strip around the gash where a thornbush caught me while stalking the rabbit. The cut isn't deep, but it bled freely.

Soot smudges one cheekbone. The top button of her blouse hangs open, revealing the hollow of her throat.

"There." She ties off the bandage and lifts my arm to inspect her work. "Keep it clean. I'll check it tomorrow."

"Thank you."

"I'm sorry about the rabbit," I say. "I'll try to catch more tomorrow. You must be hungry."

"It's *fine*." She's already turning back to the cookfire, where the skinned carcass turns on a makeshift spit. "Tomorrow, try the eastern dunes. Snib says there are thornback bushes that wayâ€”"

"Snib *says*?"

"He knows this area." She's measuring every syllable like medicine. "He lives here. And I need desert sage if I'm going to keep this place from giving us lung-rot. The smoke-hole was completely clogged when we arrived, did you know that? I had toâ€”"

She's talking too fast.

I watch her stir something in the small pot she brought from homeâ€”herbs steeping in well-water, their fragrance cutting through the ever-present goblin musk. Above the fire, bundles of dried plants hang from cords she's strung between the support posts. The straw pile where we sleep has been refreshed, the old stalks replaced with new ones.

She's *nesting*.

passages.name: 04 clover talk
passages.content:
"How's... Clover?"

Elara's hands still on the spit.

"I... checked on her." She doesn't turn around. "While you were out."

"And?"

"She's..." A long breath. "She's not fighting him anymore. Jarkrond. She just... stands there. Lets him..." Another breath. "She used to stamp and toss her head when stallions came near. Remember? At the spring market, when Lord Aldworth's stud got loose?"

I remember. Clover had nearly kicked the stable door down.

"Now she just..." Elara's voice cracks. "She's changing."

The fire crackles between us.

"Mares that are bred by ash-runners," she says quietly. "I've read about it. They're never the same afterward. Something in the... in the seed. It changes them. Makes them *want*â€”"

She stops. Her shoulders are shaking.

"Maybe we should let her go." The words come out rough. "Open the lean-to. Let her find her way back to Eboncrest."

"But then how would *we* get back?"

Elara turns. Her eyes are red-rimmed, but her jaw is set.

"On foot," she says.]I move to help her with the cooking.

Our hands brush as I take the spit from her gripâ€”my fingers too soft, too *small* against hers. I'm used to fully enclosing hers. She lets me turn the rabbit while she tends to the pot, and for a moment we work in silence, side by side, almost like we're back in our cottage.

"You've made it nicer in here," I say. "Much nicer."

She glances around at her work.

"Someone had to." Her voice is flat. "The smellâ€”" She shakes her head. "I couldn't just sit here and do nothing while you were out hunting."

"OI!"

Snib's voice cuts through the moment like a blade through silk.

He waddles in from somewhereâ€”gods know where he wasâ€”and throws himself onto his fur pile like a king returning from war. His loincloth rises, then falls.

"That smells BOOYAGH, missus!" He sniffs the air loudly, wetly. "Better than that slop Elise was makin' me!"

Elara's spine stiffens.

"Thank you," she says. The words sound like they're being pulled from her with tongs.

"See, THAT'

passages.name: 04 meal together
passages.content:
The rabbit is small.

Elara and I share what's left.

She gives me the larger portion without asking, and I try to give it back, and we do this small dance until she fixes me with a look that says *eat it or I'll force it down your throat myself*.

I eat.

"Ye need to catch MORE tomorrow, titcow," Snib announces through a mouthful of meat. "One bunny ain't gonna feed three mouths. Wellâ€”" He grins. "â€”two mouths and a CUNT what eats like a bird."

"There was only one in the burrow," I manage, tamping down anger. "And I need a better BOW, mine broke again, cutting my..."

"S'alright." Elara's hand lands on my knee under the low table she's constructed from scavenged planks. "Tomorrow you can set snares. I'm sure you'll catch more that way."

"SNARES!" Snib cackles. "Missus knows her CRAFT, don't she? Real wilderness WIFE. Bet she could survive out here even without ol' Snib to protect her."

Elara's grip tightens on my knee.

"Though, she'd miss me something AWFUL, wouldn't ye, missus?"

Silence.

"Give us a word, then," Snib prompts. "Go on. Show yer wifey what ye learned today."

My blood runs cold.

Elara's cheeks flush. Her jaw works.

Image: left
"*Gruk-thrak*," she says quietly.

The word hits me like a physical blow. I know that word. Every warrior who's fought goblins knows that wordâ€”it's their most basic affirmation, their *yes*, their *I understand and comply*.

"See?" Snib beams. "She's LEARNIN'! Give her a bit more and she'll be chatterin' away like a properâ€”"

"*Shut up*." Elara's voice is ice.

The collar doesn't even twitch.

Snib just laughs.> Later, while cleaning up...

passages.name: 04 after meal
passages.content:
"Elara."

She doesn't look up.

"That word. The Goblish."

"It's just practical." Her voice is too bright. Too controlled. "If I can communicate basic things, he's less likely to... misunderstand. And if he misunderstands..."

*The collar punishes ME.*

"I know." I set down the bowl. Cross to where she's kneeling by the fire. "I know you're trying to protect me. I know everything you do is forâ€”"

"Don't." She holds up a hand. "Please. I can'tâ€”I can't do this right now."

I kneel beside her anyway. Take her hand in mine.

"You smell like horse," she says softly.

"I know."

"You should wash. Before bed."

"Elaraâ€”"

I lean in. Press my lips to hers.

Image: For a momentâ€”one perfect, aching momentâ€”she kisses me back.

For a momentâ€”one perfect, aching momentâ€”she kisses me back.

Then she pulls away.

"Not here." Her voice is barely a whisper. "He's *watching*."

I don't turn to look at Snib's fur pile. Don't need to.

I can feel his yellow eyes on us like hands.> The next day...

passages.name: 04 day4 nightmare
passages.content:
The window of our cottage frames them like a portrait.

Inside, Elara buckles armor onto Snib's shoulders.

He stands on a stool to reach her height, his warty green flesh squeezed into plate that gleams brightly. *My* armor. My helm. She adjusts the pauldrons with the same careful fingers that once dressed wounds on my body, and her face wears an expression I cannot read.

"Higher, missus," Snib's voice slithers through the glass. "Snib's shoulders ain't quite the same as yer hubby's."

She laughs.

The sound pierces me deep. I hammer on the windowâ€”*Elara! ELARA!*â€”but my fists make no sound, or perhaps the glass swallows it, or perhaps I have no fists at all.

Snib turns.

"Oi, titcow!" His grin splits his face like a wound tearing open. "Ye can WATCH if ye want! Might learn somethin' about how a REAL hero gets dressed!"

Elara's hands pause on his helm.

She looks toward the window.

Through me.

*Past* me.

"Who are you talking to, love?"> Wake up.

passages.name: 04 waking
passages.content:
My eyes snap open.

Darkness. The reek of goblin. Straw scratching against bare skin.

*Dream. Just a dream. Just aâ€”*

My hand reaches sideways to find empty space.

My heart seizes.

I push myself upright, breasts swaying with the motion, and my gaze cuts through the pre-dawn murk toward Snib's fur pile. The shape there is small. Singular. His wet snores rattle the fetid air.

*Where is she?*

Something crashes outside.A horse's screamâ€”high and panicked, the sound of an animal in distress.

I'm moving before I think. The hide tears aside under my hand and the desert night hits me like a wall of cold silk, and I'm *running*, bare feet slapping packed sand, collar bouncing against my throat, everything exposed to the stars and the wind and whatever waits in the darknessâ€”

*Elara. ELARA.*

The lean-to looms ahead. Torchlight flickers from withinâ€”one of our travel torches, guttering in its makeshift bracket. Jarkrond's massive shape rears against the glow, forelegs pawing air, a sound tearing from his throat that's more fury than fear.

And thereâ€”

*There*â€”

Elara stands at the lean-to's entrance, her nightgown pale as bone in the torchlight, her hands raised toward the thrashing stallion.

Beyond her, through the gap in the fence she's torn open, a white shape gallops into the darkness.

Clover.> 'ELARA!'

passages.name: 04 confrontation
passages.content:
She spins. Her face is wetâ€”tears tracking silver down her cheeksâ€”and her eyes go wide as she takes in the sight of me.

"Eliseâ€”you'reâ€”you need to go back inside, you're notâ€”"

"What are you *DOING*?"

Jarkrond screams again. His hooves crash down inches from where I stand, and I feel the impact through my bare soles, feel sand spray against my shins and thighs and the soft expanse of my belly.

I grab his lead-rope without thinking.

"*EASY!*" The word tears from my throat in Aldric's voice, or as close as this body can manage. I haul on the rope with both hands, throwing my weight backward, and Jarkrond's head jerks down. "*Easy*, damn you!"

He fights me. Muscles bunch beneath grey hide. His amber eyes roll, showing white, and that sound keeps coming from his chestâ€”a keeningâ€”the grief-sound of a beast denied its mate.

Image: 'She's GONE!'
"She's GONE!" I shout at him. "She's *gone*, you monster!"

His head swings toward me.

The rage bleeds from his posture like water from a cracked vessel. His nostrils flare onceâ€”twiceâ€”drinking in something from the air around my naked flesh.

He stills.

The cold night air bites every inch of me. My breasts heave with exertion, nipples stiff and aching in the chill. The weight of my hips, my ass, my *everything*, bare and undefended beneath the predawn stars.

Jarkrond's gaze travels down my body with deliberate, *intelligent* attention.> Turn to Elara.

passages.name: 04 clover gone
passages.content:
I release the lead-rope.

Jarkrond doesn't move. Just stands there, breathing, *watching*. I turn my back on himâ€”every instinct screaming that this is wrong, and cross to where Elara stands at the broken fence.

The desert stretches before us, vast and dark, the eastern horizon just beginning to blush with the promise of dawn. Somewhere out there, a white shape grows smaller and smaller against the dunes.

"I couldn't let her stay." Elara's voice is raw. "I couldn't watch her... Ugh. I just couldn't!"

I take her hand. Her fingers are ice.

"She was mine." A sob breaks through. "Before any of this. Fed her from a bottle when her mother died. And now..."

"You saved her."

"Just one innocent thing. One creature who didn't choose this, who didn'tâ€”" Her voice cracks. "Who still had a chance to run."

"We can run too," I say quietly. "Right now. Just... walk into the dark. Find our way back toâ€”"

"The collar."

Two words. They fall like stones into still water.

"You could walk to the edge of the world and you'd still be *his*," Elara continues. Her voice has steadied somehow, found that iron core. "Still feel it when he calls. Still..."

She doesn't need to finish.> Watch Clover disappear.

passages.name: 04 dawn together
passages.content:
The first true light of dawn breaks over the eastern dunes.

The sky above shifts from black to purple to a blue so pale it's almost white, and against it, the last glimpse of Clover's white coat flickers once, twice, and is gone.

"She'll find her way back." Elara's voice is barely a whisper. "Horses always know how to find home."

"So do we."

She turns to look at me.

In the dawn light, her face is stripped of everything but the truth. The exhaustion. The fear. The love that burns beneath it all, stubborn and fierce and refusing to die no matter how many indignities this place heaps upon us.

Her eyes travel down my bodyâ€”taking in the nakedness I'd forgotten in my panic, the curves and softnesses that aren't *mine*, the collar that marks me as property. Her expression cracks. Painâ€”and beneath it, something hungrier.

"You're beautiful," she says softly.

"Don't."

"I mean it." Her hand rises. Touches my cheek. Her palm is warmer now, or perhaps the dawn has warmed us both. "I look at you and I see *you*. Not what the collar wants. Just... Aldric. My Aldric. Wearing borrowed flesh."

"Flesh that isn't mine."

"Flesh that I love." She steps closer. Her nightgown brushes against my bare skin. "Because you're inside it. Because every morning you wake up and you *choose* to keep fighting. Because you haven't given up."

"Neither have you."

Something flickers behind her eyes.

"We should go inside." She's pulling away now. "Before he wakes. Before he sees... he won't be happy about Clover. But... I'll talk him down."

I take her hand before she can retreat completely.

"Twenty-seven days," I say. "And then we go home. We *both* go home. Whatever happens between now and then... we face it together. Yes?"

Her grip tightens.

Behind us, Jarkrond stamps once in the lean-to.> Later...

passages.name: 04 snib rage
passages.content:
"WHAT."

Snib's whole body has gone rigidâ€”warty fists clenched at his sides, the tendons in his neck standing out like cords.

"What," he repeats, softer now, "have ye DONE."

"I let her go." Elara's voice doesn't waver. She stands between me and the goblin, shoulders squared, chin lifted. "She didn't deserveâ€”"

He spins, jabbing a stubby finger at Elara, then at me, then at the empty lean-to where only Jarkrond remains.

"Yeâ€”ye justâ€”ye SENT HER AWAY? Without askin'? Without so much as a BY-YER-LEAVE to the gobbo what OWNS this whole thrakking OPERATION?"

The collar *clamps*.

I drop to my knees, hands flying to my throat. The iron grinds my windpipe. Pressure floods behind my eyes.

"Snibâ€”" I gasp.

"DON'T ye 'Snib' me, titcow!" He's pacing now, his loincloth swinging with each furious step, his cock already beginning to chub beneath the fabric. "I been GOOD to ye! Both of ye! Let ye sleep TOGETHER, didn't I? Let ye wear CLOTHES when ye earned it! Fed ye from me own stores!"

"Your stores are things *we* caughtâ€”" Elara starts.

"IRRELEVANT!" Snib wheels on her. Spittle flies from his lips. "This is ME territory! ME rules! And yeâ€”" He jabs at her again. "â€”ye just DANCE in here with yer fancy HERBS and yer ATTITUDE and ye think ye can do whatever ye WANT?"> Watch helplessly.

passages.name: 04 rage escalate
passages.content:
"Jarko was HAPPY!" Snib's voice cracks on the word. He clutches at his chest, eyes rolling toward the lean-to where Jarkrond stands watching with unsettling calm. "Finally had a COMPANION! Someone to SHARE things with! And ye justâ€”ye justâ€”"

He snarls, wet and cracked, a sob buried in it.

"Took her away from him! Like she was NOTHIN'! Like Jarko's FEELINS' don't MATTER!"

The collar eases slightly. I suck in air, still kneeling in the sand, watching this... *performance*.

"Maybeâ€”" Snib's voice drops, goes silky-dangerous. "Maybe this ain't WORKIN' OUT. Havin' the missus here. Thought she'd be HELPFUL, but all she does is CAUSE PROBLEMS."

Elara's face goes white.

"Perhaps I should send her BACK to humie-town. Let her walk. A jaunt through the Sandsâ€”bit rough fer a soft city female, but she'd probably SURVIVE. And then it'd just be ME and titcow here. Nice and COZY. Plenty of QUALITY TIME."

"No." The word tears from Elara's throat. "No, I'llâ€”I'll fix this. I'll go find Clover, I'll bring her backâ€”"

"TOO LATE fer that, missus." Snib examines his claws with elaborate disinterest. "Mare's GONE. Jarko's LONELY. Someone's gotta PAY fer that."

His eyes find mine. Then slide to Elara.

"Unless..."> Oh gods...

passages.name: 04 elara deal
passages.content:
"Unless WHAT?" Elara's voice is steady, but I can see her hands trembling at her sides.

Snib's grin splits his face.

"Well NOW." He waddles closer to herâ€”close enough that she'd have to look down to meet his eyes, close enough that I can see her nostrils flare at his proximity. "Been thinkin', missus. Ye got somethin' I been wantin' to... *examine*."

"Not as big as yer WIFEY'S, mind. But they got a certain... CHARM. Nice and NATURAL. Bit of BOUNCE to 'em." He makes a cupping gesture with both hands. "Just a little FEEL. Wouldn't take but a MOMENT."

Elara's jaw works.

"ELARAâ€”" I try to rise. The collar *wrenches* me back down.

"You'll FORGET about Clover," she continues, ignoring me. "No more talk of sending me away. No more *punishments* for something that's already done."

Snib's grin widens. His loincloth strains visibly nowâ€”the fabric drawing forward, the outline of that massive shaft basically having a cloth draped over it. I watch Elara's eyes flicker down. Watch them widen. Watch them snap back up to his face.

"Ye drive a HARD bargain, missus." He cackles at his own joke. "Just a TOUCH. Nice and GENTLE-like."

passages.name: 04 revelation choice
passages.content:
"STOP!"

The word tears out of me. The collar *convulses*, and I feel tears streaming down my cheeks as I kneel there in the sand, helpless and desperate and burning with jealousy I refuse to name.

"Don'tâ€”don't let himâ€”Elara, you don't have toâ€”"

"Oh HO!" Snib spins toward me, his reaching hand falling away from Elara's chest. His eyes gleam with delight. "THERE'S the HERO SPIRIT! Getting all PROTECTIVE, are we?"

"Pleaseâ€”"

"Gettin' all PURE and OUTRAGED." He waddles toward me, his tented loincloth bobbing with each step. "Like YE ain't done WORSE."

"What?" Elara's voice is strange. Distant. "What does he mean, 'worse'?"

Snib's grin shows every broken tooth.]I kneel there.

Silent. Trembling. Watching as Snib's warty hand rises toward my wife's breast.

*Let it happen. Let her make her choice. Don't interfere, don'tâ€”*

"Yer wifey's bein' GENEROUS, hero-cunt. Real UNDERSTANDIN'. A bit like YOU, eh? Not like that night at the INN."

The world stops.

"What?" Elara's voice is strange. Distant. "What inn?"

Snib cackles.

"Oh, she didn't TELL ye?" He looks between usâ€”me on my knees, Elara standing frozen, the collar humming against my throat. "About our SPECIAL TIME in Eboncrest?"

"Elise?" Elara's voice cracks. "What is he talking about?"

The collar *loosens*.

"Go on, titcow." Snib's voice is silk and broken glass. "Tell yer wife what ye did. Orâ€”" His grin widens. "â€”I can tell her MESELF. Got a REAL good memory fer details, I do."

passages.name: 04 truth choice
passages.content:
"I had toâ€”" My voice breaks. I can't look at her. Can't see whatever's happening on her face. "He told me to. The collarâ€”I couldn't refuse a direct command, and heâ€”"

"WHAT." Elara's voice is barely a whisper. "What did he make you do."

"He made meâ€”" I swallow. "He made me touch him. With my hand. Just once. Justâ€”"
