"Flux's mercy, is thatâ€”"

"â€”never seen a goblin inside the wallsâ€”"

"â€”look at her OUTFITâ€”"

"â€”probably a pleasure-slave, you know how theyâ€”"

I keep my eyes forward. Keep walking. Keep pretending I can't hear Mrs. Fletcher's gasp, can't see how the baker's apprentice nearly drops his tray, can't feel the weight of a hundred gazes on my breasts, my ass, the collar at my throat.

*"Popular, ain't ye?"* Snib's whisper is gleeful. *"Bet they're wonderin' what ye TASTE like."*

"Eyes front," Harwick snaps at the growing crowd. "Nothing to see here. Tow

passages.name: 04 fendril reveal
passages.content:
Silence.

Fendril's gray eyes don't widen. Don't narrow. They simply... *settle*. Like a hawk finding its perch.

"HRUK!" Snib cackles from the reading chair, his muddy feet swinging. "There it is! The big reveal! Ye should see yer FACE, wizard-man!"

Fendril's attention is fixed on me with an intensity that pins me to the floor. Those thick spectacles catch the light from a dozen floating candles as he steps closer.

"You claim you are Aldric," he says quietly. "The hero who went to clear Ironrock. Three days ago."

"Yes." The word comes out strangled. "I found a chamber beneath the mines. Pre-human stonework. And thisâ€”" My hand flies to the collar. Cold metal against my fingertips. "â€”this THING was there. It... changed me. Bound me to him."

I jerk my head toward Snib, who's now examining a preserved lizard in a jar with the expression of a child at a sweetshop.

"Changed you." Fendril's voice is carefully neutral. Analytical. A scholar examining a curious specimen. "Changed how, exactly?"

"EVERYTHING." The hysteria rises before I can stop it. "My body. My voice. Myâ€”" I gesture helplessly at the obscene curves barely contained by the breast-band. "â€”EVERYTHING. But my mind is stillâ€” I'm still ME. I'm still Aldric. I remember you teaching me the wind-calling when I was twenty-three and nearly blew myself off the tower roofâ€”"

"You DID blow yourself off the roof." A ghost of a smile touches Fendril's lips. "I caught you. Barely."

"You saidâ€”" My voice breaks. Tears are coming. These THRAKKING tears that come so easily now. "â€”you said 'Aldric, you have the magical subtlety of a drunk ox.'"

Fendril goes very still.

"Touching," Snib drawls. "Real touching. Can we GET ON WITH IT? I didn't drag me property across the desert to watch ye two reminisce."

"Property." Fendril's voice doesn't change, but something in his posture does. "You claim ownership of this... person?"

"Don't CLAIM nothin'." Snib hops off the chair, waddling over to stand beside me. His hand finds my

passages.name: 04 fendril guards
passages.content:
I stand where Fendril left me, trying to breathe, trying not to think about what comes next.

*Elara.*

The name is a wound that won't stop bleeding.

Three days. She's been alone for three days. Mourning me. Probably barely eating. I know how she gets when she's worriedâ€”pacing the floors, checking the window every few minutes, burning dinner because her mind is elsewhere.

And now she's going to see THIS.

"Quit yer mopin'." Snib's found a small mirror and is examining his teeth in it. "Makin' me depressed just LOOKIN' at ye."

I don't answer.

"Here's how it's gonna work, cow-tits." He sets down the mirror, turns to face me fully. "Ye get me the gold. All ten thousand. Then ye escort me OUT of this thrakkin' townâ€”SAFELY. No tricks, no guards followin', no arrows in me back."

"And then you'll release me."

"THENâ€”" He holds up a warty finger. "â€”I ride off into the sunset. One day later, the collar lets ye go. Gives me time to get CLEAR, see? Can't have ye chasin' me down the moment yer free."

One day. One more day as his property, even after he has what he wants.

"You said when you got the gold. Not a day AFTER."

"What I SAID was I'd let ye go when I got me gold." His grin shows all those broken teeth. "Never said HOW I'd let ye go. Ye think I'm stupid? The SECOND that collar comes off, ye'll be reachin' for a sword. Nah. I need me head start."

My hands clench at my sides.

"Now," he continues, waddling closer. "Before them humies come back in and we gotta play nice..." His yellow eyes travel up my body. "Bend over."

"What?"

"Ye heard me. BEND. OVER." His voice goes hard. "All this talkin' to humans, all this 'Master Fendril' and 'Aldric the Great' shiteâ€”ye're forgettin' who ye BELONG to. Need remindin'."

The collar hums against my windpipe. A dog's choke-chain at rest."Master." The word still sticks in my throat, but I force it out. "Master, please. Before we see Elaraâ€”before you threaten herâ€”can we just... talk? About what you actually WANT?"

Snib pauses

passages.name: 04 bend over
passages.content:
Image: My hands find my knees.

"That's better." I hear him move behind me. "Now. Who do ye belong to?"

"You, Master."

"LOUDER."

"You, MASTER."

*CRACK.*

His palm connects with my ass like a thunderclap. The scale-breeches do nothing to absorb the impactâ€”the metal just TRANSFERS it, sends it rippling through flesh that won't stop JIGGLING.

"Again. Who OWNS this fat arse?"

"You do, Master!"

*CRACK.*

The second blow lands harder. I gaspâ€”can't help itâ€”the sound high and feminine and PATHETIC.

"And who's gonna be a GOOD GIRL in front of the guards? In front of yer WIFE?"

"I am, Master!"

*CRACK. CRACK. CRACK.*

Each impact sends shockwaves through my body. My tits bounce against the breast-band. My eyes water. The SOUND echoes off Fendril's stone walls, off his books and artifacts, off centuries of accumulated knowledge that does nothing to help me now.

The door opens.

"We've spoken with the mayâ€”"

Harwick stops mid-sentence.

I'm still bent over. Snib's hand is still raised. The tableau freezes like a painting of damnation.

"Ah." Fendril's voice comes from behind the guards. Carefully neutral. "I see we've... interrupted."

I straighten slowly. Face burning. Eyes on the floor.

The two guardsâ€”Harwick and the younger oneâ€”stare at me with pity so thick it could choke a man.

They KNOW. They know I'm Aldric. They've seen the parchment, heard Fendril's explanation. And now they've seen their hero bent over, getting spanked like a disobedient tavern wench.

"Right then!" Snib claps his hands together cheerfully. "We all sorted? Can we GO now?"

Harwick's jaw works. His hand hasn't left his sword.

"Master Fendril has explained the... situation." The words come out like he's chewing nails. "We understand that any harm to you results in harm toâ€”" His eyes flick to me. Away. "â€”to Aldric."

"Damn RIGHT it does." Snib raises his hand.

The air TWISTS.

Black metal manifests from nothingâ€”coiling out of the collar itself like a snake unspooling from its den. It spiral

passages.name: 04 walk home
passages.content:
*CLOP-CLICK. CLOP-CLICK. CLOP-CLICK.*

My heels ring against cobblestones I've walked a thousand times.

The leash pulls taut with each step, the leather collar-attachment digging into my throat, forcing me to keep pace with Snib's waddling stride.

Behind usâ€”twenty paces back, as orderedâ€”Harwick and the younger guard follow. Their eyes are on me. The leash. My ass SWAYING in these thrakking scale-breeches with every mincing step.

They know it's me.

They KNOW.

"Mornin'!" Snib calls out to a passing merchant. "Lovely day, innit?"

The merchantâ€”old Henrik's boy, the one who lost fingers to the wyvernâ€”stares. His cart full of turnips sits forgotten. His mouth opens. Closes. Opens again.

"That's... that's a goblin."

"And THIS is me pet." Snib tugs the leash, making me stumble closer. "Ain't she pretty?"

Henrik's boy looks at me. At my barely-contained tits, my collared throat, the leash in a goblin's hand. His face settles on horror. But his eyes linger a half-second too long on my chest.

"Move along," Harwick growls from behind us. "Town business. Nothing to see."

We move.

Past the fountain where children played this morningâ€”they're gone now, mothers having dragged them inside at the sight of us.

*CLOP-CLICK. CLOP-CLICK.*

Finally, we turn onto Temple Street.

And there it is.

Our house. Mine and Elara's. Nestled next to the smithy, just as it's always been. The roses in the window boxâ€”she must have watered them, even through her grief. The boots by the doorâ€”MY boots, Aldric's boots, still waiting for feet that may never fill them again.

The smoke from the chimney.

She's home.

My heart stops.

"Well, well." Snib's voice is thick with satisfaction. "This is gonna be GOOD."> Approach the door.

passages.name: 04 elara door
passages.content:
The door opens before I can knock.

Her hairâ€”that autumn fire I've buried my face in a thousand timesâ€”is half-undone, strands escaping a hasty braid. Dark circles bruise the skin beneath her sapphire eyes. She's been crying. Recently. The tracks still glisten on her cheeks.

She looks like a woman attending her own husband's funeral.

And then she sees us.

"Can I helpâ€”"

Her voice dies.

Her eyes find me first. Travel down. The black metal straining against my huge tits. The scale-breeches clinging to hips wider than any woman in Eboncrest. The collar at my throat.

The LEASH.

Her gaze follows the black cordâ€”follows it from my neck, down, down, to the warty green hand holding its other end.

To Snib.

She makes a strangled gasp, like someone drowning on dry land. Her hand flies to her mouth.

"Whatâ€”WHOâ€”" She's looking at me now, really LOOKING, and I can see her trying to make sense of what she's seeing. A goblin. A leash. A woman dressed like a pleasure-slave. On HER doorstep. "Get AWAY from my houseâ€”"

"Elara."

Her name breaks from my throat before I can stop it. Wet. Desperate. Nothing like Aldric's baritone.

She freezes.

"How do you know myâ€”" Her eyes narrow. Then widen. Something flickering behind themâ€”recognition trying to surface through layers of impossibility. "How do you know my NAME?"

"HRUK-HRUK!" Snib yanks the leash, pulling me forward. I stumble, tits bouncing, and he GRINS up at her. "Mornin', missus!"

"I'll SCREAM." Elara's voice has gone hard. Dangerous. I know that voice. "I'll scream and every guard in Eboncrest willâ€”"

"They're already HERE, luv." Snib jerks his thumb backward. Harwick and the younger guard stand at the garden gate, faces carefully blank. "Go on. Ask 'em why they ain't killin' me. Ask 'em who THIS is." He tugs my leash again. "Go on, cow-tits. Introduce yerself to the missus."

Elara looks to Harwick. He gives the smallest nod.

When she looks back at me, the blood leaves her face like wine poured from a glass.

"No." The

passages.name: 04 prove elara
passages.content:
"The Festival of Lights." The words tumble out, wet and desperate. "We snuck into the market square at midnight with the lanterns we'd painted for weeks. You wore this dressâ€”THIS dress, Elaraâ€”and you climbed on my shoulders to reach the high hooks. A cat startled us. We nearly fell. You laughed so hard you couldn't breathe and I had to cover your mouth so we wouldn't wake the watchman."

"The paint wasn't dry. Remember? You had blue handprints on your thighs for three days because Iâ€”" My voice cracks. "â€”because I grabbed you when we stumbled. You told everyone it was from helping the dyers.""Old Briar's Bridge." I'm crying now. Can't stop. "The rainstorm that came out of nowhere. You were shivering so hard your teeth chattered. I gave you my coat and we pressed against the oak tree and that's when Iâ€”" My voice breaks. "â€”that's when I told you I loved you. First time. You said 'finally' and punched my arm."

Her breath catches.

"We carved our initials that night. E and A. You made me add a heart because you said I was 'emotionally stunted' and needed practice. It's still there. The scar in the bark. I check it every time I cross that bridge.""Your grandfather's ring." The memory surfaces through my tears. "The Summer Solstice Fair. You thought you'd lost itâ€”tore apart every stall, every patch of grass. You were crying. I'd never seen you cry before."

"It was in your herb pouch. You'd taken it off to apply salve to that little boy's scraped knee. And later, by the fire, you put it on my finger." I hold up my handâ€”these small, feminine fingersâ€”and imagine the weight of it. "You asked if I'd always be your knight. Even when I turned into an old, grumpy man."

Her lip trembles.

"I said forever and always."

She stares at me.

At my eyes.

The same moss-green that Aldric had. The only thing unchanged.

"Aldric?"

The word is barely a whisper.

And then she's CRASHING into me.

Her arms wrap around my neckâ€”pulling me down because I'm SHORTER nowâ€”and she's sobbing into m

passages.name: 04 stop elara
passages.content:
I see it happen like a painting.

The knife catches the afternoon sunâ€”that good butcher's blade, the one she uses for Sunday roastsâ€”and it GLEAMS with righteous fury. Elara's autumn hair flies behind her like a war banner. Her face is twisted with grief and rage and our years of love turned to VENGEANCE.

She's beautiful.

She's TERRIFYING.

And I don't stop her.

Some part of meâ€”the part that's still Aldric, still the warrior who killed a hundred goblins, still the man who HATES this creature with every fiber of his beingâ€”that part WANTS this. Wants to see that blade sink into green flesh. Wants to hear him SCREAM.

*Do it. DO IT. End this nightmareâ€”*

The blade finds its mark.

Snib's eyes go wide. His mouth opensâ€”to curse, to threaten, to laughâ€”but only blood comes out.

"That's for my HUSBAND," Elara snarls, and TWISTS.

Snib crumples.

And the collarâ€”

â€”WAKES.

Cold iron BITES into my throat. CRUSHINGâ€”instant and absolute, instant and absolute, ancient magic completing its oldest promise.

*Master dies. Slave dies.*

I try to scream but there's no air. Try to claw at the metal but my fingers find no purchase. The world goes grey at the edges, then black, thenâ€”

"ALDRIC!" Elara's voice, distant, drowning. "ALDRIC, NOâ€”"

She's beside me. Hands on the collar. Pulling. SCREAMING for help.

But there's nothing to pull. No clasp. No seam. Just metal that won't stop CONSTRICTINGâ€”

The guards are shouting. Someone's running for a blacksmith. Elara is sobbing my name over and over, her hands red with goblin blood, her eyes wild with a new horrorâ€”

She killed the monster.

And killed me too.

The last thing I see: her face. Beautiful. Broken. Understanding too late what she's done.

The last thing I feel: the collar finishing what it started.

The last thing I hear: my wife screaming as the light goes out.

*I love you.*

*I'm sorry.*

*Iâ€”*

]Time slows.

I see it unfold in perfect clarityâ€”the way Elara's hand closes on the knife handle, the way her body PIVOTS, the way

passages.name: 04 explain snib
passages.content:
Image: 'He wants... he wants ten thousand gold.'

"He wants... he wants ten thousand gold."

Elara flinches like she's been slapped.

"Ten THOUSAND?" She repeats it like she's testing whether the words are real. "Aldric, that's... that's almost EVERYTHING. That's our SAVINGS. That's what we were putting aside for..."

She doesn't finish.

*For the baby. For the future. For the life we were building together.*

"I know."

)"Course, she's already knocked a bit off," Snib says casually, examining his claws. "Been a GOOD girl, yer husband. Very... cooperative."

Elara's head snaps toward him. Then toward me.

"What does that MEAN?"

Heat crawls up my neck like a rash. I can't speak. Can't explain. Can't tell her about kneeling in the filth of his hut, about the words he made me say, about BEGGING him toâ€”

Elara stares at me. A light goes out behind her eyes.

"We should go to the bank," I whisper. "Please. Can we just... go?")"She's been REAL eager to work off her debt," Snib chuckles. "Should've SEEN her. Waggling that fat arse, BEGGIN' me toâ€”"

"What?" Elara's voice cuts like glass. "Begging you to WHAT?"

I can't look at her. My face is burning. The memory of those wordsâ€”*Please Master Snib, grab my ass*â€”echoes in my skull like a death knell.

"Aldric." Her hand grabs my chin, forces me to meet her eyes. "What did you DO?"

"I..." My throat closes. "I just... I was trying to reduce the debt. Every bit helps, and he said if Iâ€”"

"If she ASKED nice," Snib finishes, still grinning.

Elara's hand drops from my face like I've burned her.

"The bank," I manage. "We should... we should go.")"Least she knows how to WORK," Snib snickers. "Should've seen her scrubbin' me floors yesterday. Naked as the day she was born. All that MEAT just swingin' and bouncin'â€”"

"NAKED?" Elara's voice cracks.

"Had to earn her keep somehow." Snib shrugs. "Can't have her wearin' that pretty armor while she's doin' CHORES, can I? Gets all sweaty. Needed to AIR OUT."

Elara's jaw tightens. Someth

passages.name: 04 leave for bank
passages.content:
A woman I don't recognize clutches her child to her skirts as we pass. An old manâ€”I think he sells candles near the fountainâ€”makes a warding sign against evil. Two young men who might have been guards-in-training openly GAWK at my chest, elbowing each other and whispering.

*CLOP-CLICK. CLOP-CLICK.*

My heels ring against the cobblestones. Each step makes everything BOUNCE. The breast-band strains. The scale-breeches cling.

Elara walks ahead of us. Spine straight. Head high. Refusing to look back.

But Snib is looking at HER.

His yellow eyes crawl down her back. Find her hips beneath the green dress. Settle on her ass and STAY there.

Image: But I see Snib looking at HER.

"Nice body, yer wife," he murmurs. Just loud enough for me to hear.

passages.name: 04 response walking to bank
passages.content:
"Keep your EYES off her!"

The words come out before I can stop them.

Elara half-turns.

Snib's grin spreads slowly. His yellow eyes never leave my wife's backside.

"Or WHAT, cow-tits?" He gives my butt a casual squeeze. "Gonna stop me? Gonna MAKE me look somewhere else?" His free hand gestures at my chest. "Cause from where I'm standin', ye ain't got much LEVERAGE."

"She's not part of this. Leave her ALONE."

"Ain't touchin' her, am I? Just LOOKIN'." He scratches his chin. "Though now ye mention it... pretty little thing, yer wife. Them red curls. Them big blue eyes. Bet she'd look REAL nice on her knees."

"You BASTARDâ€”"

He yanks the leash. HARD. I stumble, nearly fall, tits swinging wildly. By the time I catch my balance, Elara has turned fully, watching with horror.

"Everything alright?"

"FINE," Snib answers for me. "Yer husband just gets FEISTY sometimes. Don't worryâ€”I know how to calm her down."

Image: Right there, in the middle of the street.

His hand finds my ass. Squeezes. Right there, in the middle of the street.

Elara's face goes pale.

"Keep walkin', missus." Snib's voice is cheerful. "We got BANKIN' to do.""Please." The word comes out strangled. "Don't... don't look at her like that."

"Like WHAT?" His grin is innocent. Mocking. "Can't help where me eyes go, can I? Natural instinct. See a pretty female, gotta APPRECIATE."

"She's my WIFE."

Image: He gives my ass a casual slap.

"And YER me property." He gives my ass a casual slap. "So, that makes her... what? Me property's property? Me ALMOST-property?"

"That's notâ€”"

"Tell ye what." His voice drops to a whisper. Just for me. "Ye shut yer mouth about where I look, or maybe I tell yer precious wifey what ye got up to last night. All that moanin' and groanin' in the hay while SHE was probably cryin' herself to sleep..."

My blood runs cold.

"Didn't THINK so." He pats my hip almost affectionately. "Nowâ€”keep walkin'. And maybe I'll keep me mouth shut about what happened in me hut last night."

I

passages.name: 04 bank approach
passages.content:
For the life we were supposed to have.

Mayor Bramble is coming down the steps as we approach.

He freezes when he sees us. Sweats white.

"Ah. Aldric. I meanâ€”" He mops his forehead with a silk kerchief. "The... situation. Yes. I'm terribly sorry about... everything."

He won't meet my eyes. Won't look at Snib. Won't acknowledge Elara at all.

"Mayor." Fendril's voice comes from behind us. I didn't hear him approach. "A word?"

"I really must be going. Council matters. Very pressing." Bramble is already backing away. "I wish I could do more. Truly. But my hands are..."

He turns and FLEES down a side street.

"What was THAT about?" Snib's eyes narrow.

"Let's find out." Fendril's voice is carefully neutral, but I can see his jaw tighten.

Image: Inside, the bank is all polished marble and hushed voices.

Inside, the bank is all polished marble and hushed voices. A single teller sits behind iron barsâ€”young, nervous, sweating through his collar. He's got papers spread before him. Official-looking papers with royal seals.

And Fendril's identity parchment. The one that proves I'm Aldric.

"Ah." The teller's voice cracks. "You're... you're here. About the account."

"I want to withdraw ten thousand gold pieces." My voice doesn't shake much. "The verification is right there. I AM Aldric. Fendril confirmed it magically."

The teller swallows. Glances at the papers.

"Yes. The verification is... is valid. Your identity is confirmed." He pauses. "However..."

"However WHAT?" Snib has climbed onto a bench to see over the counter. "She's got gold. She wants gold. GIVE her the gold."

"It's not that simple, sir. When Master Aldric was reported missing three days ago, standard protocol was enacted." The teller's fingers tremble as he points to one of the sealed documents. "Any account holding more than five thousand gold pieces enters a thirty-day verification hold."

The words don't make sense. Then they do.

"Thirty DAYS?"

"It's... it's to prevent claim fraud." The teller wo

passages.name: 04 selling stuff
passages.content:
We stumble out of the bank. The fifty coins weigh heavy in the pouch at my hipâ€”a fortune that's NOTHING. Not even a drop in the ocean of what Snib demands.

Snib reaches into the pouches at my waist. I've been carrying his "valuables" like I'm a pack animal. His claws rummage, pulling outâ€”

"Still got me shinies!" He holds up a tarnished brass ring set with what might be glass. "And me sparklies!" A broken comb missing half its teeth. A bent copper bracelet green with verdigris. A necklace of what looks like rat skulls strung on sinew.

Elara stares at the collection.

I watch her face crumble.

"Those are..." She can't finish.

"VALUABLES!" Snib clutches them protectively. "Got 'em off dead humies! And live ones! That ring thereâ€”" He points at the brass circle. "She was CRYIN' when I took it. Means it's IMPORTANT!"

The laugh of someone watching their world collapse into absurdity.

"You're going to sell... RAT SKULLS... to pay off ten thousand gold."

"Ye humies don't understand VALUE!" Snib sounds genuinely offended. "This is prime gobbo merchandise! Got BOOYAGH, these do!"

"Booyagh," Elara repeats flatly.

"MAGIC! POWER! SPARKLE!" Snib waves the broken comb like it's Whisperwind itself. "Any gobbo worth his seed-sacks would trade good shinies for this haul!"

I watch my wife's face cycle through grief, rage, and finallyâ€”

Exhaustion.

"I can't do this," she whispers. And then, louder, already backing away: "I CAN'T. Fifty gold out of ten thousandâ€”some BUREAUCRATICâ€”and he's waving rat skulls around talking about BOOYAGH and I just..."> Comfort her.

passages.name: 04 elara leaves
passages.content:
"We can figure this out. We just need to wait thirty daysâ€”"

"THIRTY DAYS." Her voice cracks. "Thirty days of you... of HIM... of..."

She looks at Snib. At his hand on my hip. At the collar around my neck.

At the body that used to be her husband.

"I need to think." She's already turning. "There has to be another way. I'll... I'll talk to people. Find someone who can help. Maybe there's a way to break the hold, orâ€”"

"Elara, WAITâ€”"

But she's gone. Walking fast. Then faster. Almost running.

"Well." Snib tugs at my hip, adjusting his grip. "That went WELL. Yer wife's got a temper, don't she?" He grins up at me. "Reminds me of YOU. Before I broke ye in proper."

passages.name: 04 selling stuff go
passages.content:
I don't respond.

"RIGHT THEN!" He claps his hands together. "Market time! Got SHINIES to sell!"

The guardsâ€”still following, still watchingâ€”exchange glances.

"Lead on, cow-tits. And put some WIGGLE in it. Maybe someone'll pay extra if they like the VIEW.""I am NOT broken in."

Snib's grin doesn't falter.

His hand twitches.

Black metal COILS from the collarâ€”that leash, manifesting from nothing, the end slapping into his waiting palm. He YANKS.

I fold forward. Can't help it. The collar DRAGS me down until my face is level with his, until his rotten breath washes over my lips.

"Not broken, eh?"

His tongueâ€”grey-green, too long, WETâ€”drags across my mouth. A slow, deliberate lick that leaves slime on my lips.

I whimper.

Can't stop it. The sound just comes outâ€”high, pathetic, FEMININE.

Harwick turns away. The younger guard studies his boots.

"Would ALDRIC let me do that?" Snib's voice is a purr. "Would the great HERO stand there and take a gobbo's spit on his pretty lips?"

I can't answer.

"Didn't THINK so." He releases the leash. It dissolves back into the collar like smoke. "Nowâ€”market time! Got SHINIES to sell! And ye'd better put some WIGGLE in them hips, bounce-bags. Maybe someone'll pay extra if they like the VIEW.""She's SICK of you. We ALL are."

Snib's eyes narrow.

Then that horrible grin spreads.

Black metal SPIRALS from my collarâ€”the leash, conjured from nothing. It lands in his palm with a soft clink. He YANKS.

My body jackknifes forward. Tits swing. Hair falls in my face. And suddenly I'm bent double, nose-to-nose with the creature who owns me.

"Sick of ME?" His breath is hot against my lips. "That's CUTE, tit-slave. Real cute."

His tongue slithers out. Drags across my mouth. Slow. WET. Leaving a trail of goblin-spit from corner to corner.

I whimper. The sound escapes before I can stop it.

Harwick's jaw tightens. He looks away. The younger guard finds something fascinating on the ground.

"Know what I think?" Snib's voice drops low. "I think

passages.name: 04 market humiliation
passages.content:
The market square of Eboncrest sprawls before usâ€”merchants hawking wares, children darting between stalls, the smell of fresh bread and horse dung mingling in the afternoon air.

Bought apples from Old Marta's cart. Haggled with Henrik over leather prices. Shared ale with the blacksmith after a successful hunt.

Now I walk them with a goblin's hand on my ass and fifty gold coins that might as well be fifty copper.

"STEP LIVELY!" Snib's voice carries. Heads turn. "Me pet here's got business to conduct!"

The guardsâ€”Harwick and the younger oneâ€”follow at a distance. Their presence is the only thing keeping the crowd from... I don't know. Attacking? Fleeing? Both?

"S'alright, folks!" The younger guard calls out, voice strained. "Town business! They are the mayor's protection!"

Thank the Ephemerals the people still don't know who I am. Unfortunately, the guards do.

First stop: Thom's butcher stall.

I used to buy lamb from Thom every Solstice. He'd save me the good cuts. We'd talk about the weather, about hunting, about whether the winter would be hard.

Now he stares at my chest like he's never seen breasts before.

"I... can I help..." His voice trails off. His eyes don't.

Image: 'Sir, I'm a BUTCHER.'

"Me pet here's got merchandise!" Snib shoves past me, slapping his "treasures" onto the blood-stained counter. "PRIME goods! Shinies and sparklies! What'll ye give me?"

The collar.

More Thraan-vek words spill from her lips in a grotesque parody of our tongue. "KRIKAN! RAZAN! ZETRAN!" She repeats the words over and over, each utterance growing weaker.> 'Let her go!']For a fleeting moment, the monstrosity halts, the endless cruel grin vanishes.

Her sapphire eyes, masked beneath layers of Maraan's nothingness, flicke

passages.name: 20 miracle
passages.content:
"I LOVE YOU, ELARA!" I shout in desperation.

A stone capstone breaks free, tumbling to the ground nearest to where I stand. More enormous chunks rain down, the ground beneath me buckling and shuddering.

Elara's flaming, wretched eyes meet mine one last time, her face a mask of pure, sorrowful fury. Despite the monstrous form she has taken, the pain is still hers - an unbridled agony reserved for betrayed lovers and shattered souls.

"I LOVED YOU TOO!" she shrieks, the sound tearing through everything else, through the magic, through the falling rocks, through our entwined destinies.

With a final, agonizing scream, her body pulses with one last surge of immense purple energy, and the entire cavern collapses in a wave of dark, violent force.> The cavern collapses."Let her go!" I scream, each word ripping from my lips like a prayer. I am pleading to Maraan, as much as I am beseeching my wife.

She points a shaking, deformed finger at me, her mouth opening to speak. "Freeâ€¦ my husbandâ€¦ or... be imprisoned... in my body... forever," she grates out, her voice low and distorted.

A chill runs up my spine.

But she doesn't back down.

"KRIKAN! RAZAN! ZETRAN!" she commands again, the command echoed by the hundreds of mouths that decorate her tentacles.

I close my eyes and brace myself as a brutal wave of energy crashes down on me. It feels like I'm being torn apart and stitched back together all at once. There is a soft clink as the collar falls from my neck, the sound echoing in the vast cavern.

When I open my eyes again, I am still Elise. The body I hoped would disappear remains as it is â€” voluptuously curvaceous, undeniably feminine. A harsh realization dawns on me. I am free from the collar, but not from my female body.

Then, a piercing scream cuts through the air. Elara's head tilts back, and she lets out a sound that is too visceral, too primal to be human. Her demonic form writhes in agony, her tentacles flailing wildly.> She erupts with energy.

passages.name: 20 explosion
passages.content:
Her eyes... they hold the final echo of our lost love, mingled with an inescapable rage. The ground shakes violently beneath me, each breath is desperate, choked with dust, and salted tears blur my vision.

"ELARA!" I cry out, voice breaking, but then it happens.

All sound narrows to a single deafening crash as the colossal pillar above us gives way.

The weight is impossible, the impact immediate.

There's a crushing, sickening crunch.

And thenâ€”

(:"19 procession",19,"You were crushed when the cavern collapsed.")]With an ear-splitting crack, Maraanâ€™s essence explodes out of her, tearing a ragged hole through the cavern ceiling. The raw power of the blast thrusts me backwards, my ears ringing and vision blurring.> Elara lies motionless on the cavern floor.

passages.name: 20 dust settles
passages.content:
Image: borderless
Her body spasms, her skin returning to its normal pale hue, her hair pooling around her like a molten halo. The dagger-wound is gone, replaced by smooth, unmarred flesh.

Elara looks up at me with glassy eyes that blink in the torchlight. Sheâ€™s naked and trembling - but sheâ€™s Elara.

â€œE-Elise,â€ she whispers, before bursting into heart-wrenching sobs. Itâ€™s Elaraâ€™s voice. Her human voice. My wife is back.

Cautiously, I help Elara to her feet, wrapping the torn remnants of a royal cloak around her trembling body. The once grand cloak is now soaked in grime and blood, but itâ€™s the only shred of modesty we have in this godforsaken place. The dead bodies of Zephyrion's men lay silent around us, a grim tableau of death and betrayal.

Elara clings to me as we move away from the center of the devastation. Her weak legs struggle under her weight, but the steel in her sapphire eyes is unmistakable.> A groan echoes through the cavern.

passages.name: 20 collapse
passages.content:
The ground shakes beneath us as the ancient city ripples with a violent shudder. Dust and debris rain down from the cavern ceiling, a loud crack echoing from deep within the sanctum as the very earth seems to rebel against the desecration of its guardians.

Suddenly, I spot movement through the settling dust. Wounded and weary, my friends appear. Jonah's bow is slung across his back, his quiver empty, his body bruised but alive. Duncan staggers towards us, leaning heavily on Roderick who is nursing a bloody arm. Garrett supports two guardsmen. All of them reek of fear and relief and a shocking exhaustion that sinks deep into their marrow.

Jonah hollers, "We have to move. Now!"

â€œMy wife...â€ I manage to choke out, my chest tight as I clasp Elara's frail form closer, desperate to keep her safe. â€œI will not leave her.â€

â€œNo oneâ€™s asking you to,â€ Roderick pants through gritted teeth. With a shared nod, two of the Eboncrest guardsmen stumble towards us, their heavily armored forms wobbling with unsteady steps as they take Elara's weight from me.

Then we rush, stumbling through the collapsing cavern, guided only by the dim light of our forgotten torches. Each sound echoes ominously under the thunderous symphony of the crashing structures. The sanctuary that once stood as a testament to an ancient civilization now crumbles, paying its due to time and decay.

The way is fraught with danger. Falling rocks threaten to crush us while the unsteady ground threatens to swallow us whole. But together, we push on. We move in a haphazard formation, each one of us driven by raw desperation and adrenalineâ€¦ each step fueled by the hope of survival.

Aldricâ€™s friends take the lead, the guardsmen placing themselves between us and danger, shielding us with their bodies. As we inch towards safety, I am struck by their bravery â€“ their loyalty. These men who I had learned to fight alongside as Aldric, have risked their lives for Elise.

An eternity passes before we finally emerge from the

passages.name: 21 epilogue begin
passages.content: [[6 months later.]]]

passages.name: 21 epilogue
passages.content:
(:21,"The Hunt")The sharp bite of the wind is dulled by the heavy, fur-lined cloaks we wear, their warmth seeping right into our bones as our horses gallop tirelessly through the snow-dusted mountain pass. The sun is just beginning to crawl above the distant peaks of the Ironspike Mountains, blushing the crisp morning in hues of gold and rose. The soft glow lends an ethereal beauty to an otherwise harsh landscape.

Elara rides a horse-length away from me, her auburn hair streaming in the wind like wildfire. Her sapphire eyes are bright and focused, her leather-clad body moving in effortless sync with her horse's rhythm. The bow strapped across her back is a stark reminder of our chosen life â€“ a life on the road, of swords and magic, of revenge and justice.

We're not husband and wife anymore, not really. We're much more and much less at the same time â€“ we're warriors, each bound to the other. Connected by a shared destiny, a shared past, we now stand as two pillars - resilient, steadfast, and unbroken.

And we still fuck, of course! Itâ€™s important, especially in the cold nights weâ€™ve been spending, up in the Ironspikes.

Drawing in a deep breath, I signal my horse to halt. The tracks we've been following are fresher here, the goblinsâ€™ haphazard footprints marring the otherwise pristine snow. "Look here, Elara." I point to a crushed patch of snow just off the trail. â€œFresh. They're close.â€

She reins in her horse next to me and studies the indentations in the snow. There's a determined glint in her eyes as she looks up at me.

The scent of wet earth, pine and wildflowers fill my nostrils as our horses trot alongside a winding brook, heading further into the heart of the mountains. Elara is quick to comprehend the tracking nuances I share, her observant gaze scanning the surrounding woods for signs of goblin passage.

We rise a hill, and down in the distance, nestled between the broad shoulders of two mountains, is the city of Thuulk. Spires of shimmering opal and ony

passages.name: 21 wrong
passages.content:
"It's too quiet," I say, urging my horse to slow.

Suddenly, there's a rustle of foliage, and goblins spring out from the shadows, their yellow eyes glowing with malicious glee. My horse rears, her ear-splitting neigh echoing across the snow-covered mountains.

My heart pounds, the familiar rush of adrenaline coursing through my veins as I draw Whisperwind. Beside me, I hear the soft whoosh of an arrow being released, and a goblin squeals as he drops to the ground, Elara's arrow lodged deep in his chest.

She maneuvers her horse with an unusual grace, an almost feral grin on her face. She is enjoying this, the thrill of the fight. Her bow sings again and another goblin falls.

â€œElara, keep your back to me!â€ I say, my voice cutting through the chaos. â€œWatch your flank!â€> React!

passages.name: 21 react
passages.content:
I slice through a goblin that lunges at me, the sharpness of Whisperwind meeting no resistance as I cleave him in half. The sickening smell of viscera fills the air, but there's no time to think, only to react.

The goblins rush us, their razor-sharp claws slashing as they try to bring us down. Their cocks bob with each jump, ugly, fat things, and a wave of disgust washes over me. They think weâ€™re easy prey, and I know for a fact, that theyâ€™re envisioning dragging us into their tents once theyâ€™ve subdued us.

Elaraâ€™s arrow finds its mark, taking down another. She has a natural knack for archery, it seems. She's still a little clumsy, her grip too tight, her pull a little strained, but her eyes... In her eyes, there is an undeniable determination. Almostâ€¦ frightening.

One goblin sneaks behind her, lunging and pulling her from her horse. Her bow skitters off to the side. His schlong twitches excitedly as he looms over her.

Then, Elara smiles - too wide.

Her hand morphs into a writhing mass of tentacles. The goblin's squeals are cut short as her tendrils wrap around his tiny head, snapping it with a sickening crunch.

I stop mid-swing, staring slack-jawed at Elara. She just shrugs.

â€œGuess Maraan left me a little present," she shrugs.

I laugh, despite the situation, despite the chilling sight of Elara's new abilities.

â€œIâ€™m just glad you're on my side,â€ I say.

"Always." she replies with a wicked smirk, as I skewer another goblin. "And, I discovered a few nights agoâ€¦ I can grow these tentacles anywhere if I try..."

My cheeks flush at the implication, images of a very different kind of battle flashing in my mind.

The last goblin falls to the ground, its sickly green limbs twitching in the virgin snow. One of them, however, still clings to life.

Dragging the injured goblin out of the snow, I press Whisperwind against his throat. His yellow eyes widen with fear, and his cock, once hard and eager, wilts pathetically against his belly.> Interrogate him.

passages.name: 21 interrogate
passages.content:
"Where is Snib?" I ask, my voice a chilling whisper in the silent, snow-filled woods. â€œWas he traveling with you?â€

"S-Skulgaroth!" the goblin squeals in terror, his yellow eyes darting between Elara and me as he stammers out the word like a death curse. Skulgaroth. A name whispered with dread among their kind.

â€œIâ€™ll never say nothinâ€™! Skulgaroth, Skulgaroth!â€ He repeats the word like a talisman, a protective charm against death.

Elara tuts, a gleam in her sapphire eyes as she steps forward. "I believe you," she murmurs quietly. With swift, brutal precision, she stomps her boot down on the creature's throat. Its eyes widen in shock, then dull as the life seeps out of it.

I shudder involuntarily. As much as I understand the need to kill, the casualness of it sends a chill racing down my spine. Yet, Elara just wipes her boot on the snow and turns back to her usual cheerful self.

â€œThere should be other goblin tracks we can pick up, right?"

I nod, and my gaze slips to the distant city of Thuulk. The morning sun reflects off the opal and onyx spires, bathing the city in warm hues. A glimmer of hope sparks in my heart, and I feel a small smirk tug at my lips.

"I think I know someone who could help us," I reply. Elara grins at me, her bow slung snugly against her back and her eyes sparkling with the thrill of the hunt.

â€œAh, I get to meet that pretty little goblin girl youâ€™ve been telling me about?â€

â€œYes, but keep your tentacles off her!â€ I wink.

It seems light, to joke about the remnants of an ancient god that seem to be festering inside Elara. But, I figure we havenâ€™t learned much, if we canâ€™t learn laugh at the sick jokes the gods have played on both of us.

As the sun finally peeks over the horizon, we mount our horses, leaving the grisly scene behind.

What lies ahead is uncertain, but we will face it together.

The End]View credits?

passages.name: Goblins
passages.content:
A Comprehensive Treatise on the Goblinoid Species

**Dr. Ignatius Bramblethorne, M.A., D.Phil., F.R.S., Chair of Evolutionary Xenobiology, University of Thuulk**

*Being a Complete Natural History of the Green Plague, their Customs, Physiognomy, and Terrible Decline*

**Anatomical Description**

The common goblin stands between three and four feet in stature, though chieftains may reach five feet when well-fed from birthâ€”a phenomenon my colleague Professor Blackwater terms "nutritional caste determination." The skin ranges from pond-scum green to deep forest emerald, typically mottled with warts that weep a mild irritant when aroused. The skull is overlarge for the body, housing surprisingly complex neural matter that has, tragically, atrophied toward singular purpose over recent generations.

Most striking to the observer is the grotesque sexual dimorphism. Males sport genitalia that would shame a donkeyâ€”nine to fourteen inches when engorged, thick as a maiden's wrist, purple-headed and perpetually weeping that damnable precum that has doomed so many human settlements. The testes hang like overripe melons, visibly churning with their cursed productivity. By contrast, the increasingly rare females possess almost human-like beauty in miniature: violet or amber eyes, curves that would charm any tavern, and most remarkably, functioning intellects undimmed by the reproductive madness that has consumed their males.

**Goblin Society**

Here I must reference the seminal work of Professor Angharad Fflur, whose *Dialects of the Dark Deeps* documents the goblin transformation from a culture of surprising sophistication to the current state of roving rape-gangs. Goblins once possessed art, literature (crude but extant), even rudimentary philosophy centered on their deity Storak and his emanations. Cave paintings in the Ironspike Mountains depict complex theological debates rendered in surprising detail.

But the species has fallen victim to its own evolutionary success. As Pr

passages.name: Jarkrond
passages.content:
Jarkrond

Jarkrond is an ash-runnerâ€”one of the desert horses that roam the Shifting Sands and choose their own masters. He stands sixteen hands at the withers, stocky where a warhorse would be sleek, his barrel chest wider than any Valarian courser's. His hide is the color of cold hearth-ash, rough-textured and mangy in patches, with a ridge of coarse hair running from poll to dock like the spine of some half-buried lizard. His hooves are broad and slightly splayed, padded underneath for floating across powder sand, and when he walks on stone they make a sound like knucklebones rattling in a cup.

His eyes are the color of fire-warmed amber, and they hold an intelligence that has nothing equine about it. Ash-runners are problem-solvers, place-rememberers, partner-choosersâ€”they evaluate the creatures around them as potential allies or prey, and Jarkrond evaluates constantly. His ears, veined like bat-wings, swivel independently to track sound and dump heat into the desert air. His nostrils can slit nearly closed against sandstorms or flare wide to drink in scent from miles away.

Desert horses do not accept bits. Do not tolerate spurs. Will go rigid as petrified wood if a rider attempts force, then explode into motion calculated to break bones. Ash-runners choose their partners through rituals of salt-sharing and whistle-signals that map onto their own social hierarchies, and Jarkrond chose Snib years agoâ€”recognized something in the clever little predator that matched his own opportunistic nature. They raid together. Snib caches water and cuts thorny forage and stands watch at night. Jarkrond carries him to places where mares can be found, because ash-runner stallions are driven by a breeding imperative that borders on obsession.

The species runs heavily maleâ€”six colts born for every four filliesâ€”and this scarcity has shaped them into roving seed-spreaders who will mount anything vaguely equine when the rut rises. Domestic mares, wild jennies, the mountain ponies of

passages.name: Sandwalkers
passages.content:
The Bone-Readers of the Shifting Wastes
**From the journals of Ser Marcus Thorne, Knight-Cartographer of the Crown**

Call them Sandwalkers if you mustâ€”the Valarian name for a people who name themselves nothing at all. They say a man who speaks his tribe's true name gives enemies power over his blood. So they are the *Kheth-ai-Marrow* in their own tongueâ€”"Those Who Read the Bones"â€”and they will cut your throat for using even that much without permission.

They are human. That must be stated clearly, for the Crown's propaganda paints them as something else. But they have walked the Shifting Sands and the surrounding marshlands for so many generations that the land has... *changed* them in their souls as well as bodies.

No census has survived the attempt to count them. They move in tribal bands of ten to fifty, following water-patterns the rest of us cannot perceive. The desert tribes (*Kheth-Suul*) and the marsh tribes (*Kheth-Muur*) share blood but not territory, meeting only at the great Bone-Moots held when the red star risesâ€”every seven years by Valarian counting.

**Everything begins and ends with bone.**

A Sandwalker child is born onto a mat woven from the finger-bones of ancestors. At the age of eight, they consume the rendered marrow of their great-grandmother. At fourteen, they kill their first worthy enemy and crack that enemy's skull to read the future written in the sutures.

This is not metaphor. I have *witnessed* the Bone-Seers work. They spread the fragments on stretched hide, apply oils that make the calcium fluoresce in moonlight, and read patterns that areâ€”Ephemerals help meâ€”*accurate*.

The magicâ€”for it *is* magic, whatever the University's dithering academics claimâ€”appears to derive from belief in the *Kharaketh*, the Bone-Mother, whom they worship as the only god worth fearing. She speaks through calcium and kerite. Every Sandwalker carries a pouch of ancestor-fragments, and consulting them before any significant decision is as automatic as br

passages.name: Skrall
passages.content:
Skrall

**Name:** Skrall
**Classification:** Subterranean humanoid
**Typical Habitat:** Old dungeons, underground lairs, abandoned ruins

**Physical Description:**
Skralls are hunched, wiry creatures with rugged, dark skin that camouflages well in their dark, rocky habitats. They possess sharp, angular features, with glowing red or yellow eyes that pierce through the darkness of their underground worlds. Their bodies are nimble and adapted for climbing and crawling through narrow, rocky passages.

**Description:**
Skralls are remnants of a once-intelligent and sophisticated race that has now devolved into primitive societies. Historical accounts suggest that the Skralls were initially a thriving civilization alongside the K'Tarran (some even theorize that they ARE the K'Tarran), who had deep knowledge of the earth sciences and arcane arts. They built vast underground cities and temples, some of which still stand as haunted ruins scattered across the landscapes of Zaelasia.

A cataclysmic event, which old texts attribute to "a darkness that swallowed their knowledge," led to the rapid decline of their society. This darkness is often speculated to have been a combination of a devastating natural disaster and an internal collapse possibly accelerated by overreliance on dark magic practices. In the millennia that followed, the Skralls lost their civilization's sophisticated nature and regressed into scattered tribes inhabiting the ruins of their ancestors.

**Societal Structure:**
Modern Skrall societies are tribal and operate under a rudimentary hierarchy where strength and cunning are the primary means of rising in status. Each tribe is led by a Skrall King, who is not only the strongest but often the most cunning individual within the group. The King's rule is challenged frequently, leading to a volatile and ever-shifting leadership dynamic.

Skralls are fiercely territorial and organize themselves around the strategic points of their underground habitats, which are

passages.name: Aethel-thuvari
passages.content:
Aethel-thuvari (The Telenil Language)

**Dr. Cordelia Ravenshollow, Xenolinguistic Studies, University of Thuulk**

*From "Songs Written in Air: A Primer on Forest Tongues"*

---

Aethel-thuvari operates on tonal intervals rather than fixed meanings. Each two-syllable root carries base semantic weight, but the relationship between the pitches determines function. A rising-falling interval makes verbs, level-level makes nouns, falling-rising creates questions.

**Core Structure**

Built from CV (consonant-vowel) pairs exclusively. No consonant clusters exist. The five vowels (a, e, i, o, u) combine with twelve consonants (h, k, l, m, n, r, s, t, v, w, y, Ê»). The glottal stop (Ê») functions as a "breath reset," allowing speakers to chain concepts without breaking tonal flow.

Example: *thuva* (tree/to grow) becomes:
- thÃºvÃ  (falling tones): "ancient tree"
- thÃ¹vÃ¡ (rising tones): "to grow toward light"
- thÅ«vÄ (level tones): "the concept of tree-ness"

**Temporal Breathing**

Time lives in vowel length. Present stretches one beat (*kala* - "now-beauty"), past holds two (*kaala* - "remembered beauty"), future breathes three (*kaaala* - "beauty approaching"). Children learn by hummingâ€”grammar is melody internalized before words.

**The Whisper Particles**

Sentence-final particles, voiced so softly humans often miss them, alter entire meanings:
- *-wei*: observed truth
- *-sae*: inherited knowledge
- *-oro*: dreamed/envisioned
- *-thi*: temporary state

"MeliÊ»ana thuva-wei" = "The light dances through trees (I see it)"
"MeliÊ»ana thuva-sae" = "The light dances through trees (as it always has)"

**Sacred Incompletions**

The Telenil never grammatically complete statements about death, love, or magic. These concepts require the listener to "finish the harmony" mentally. A declaration of love literally cannot be spoken aloneâ€”it requires another voice to complete the tonal chord, making true love linguistically impossible to declare falsely.

**Root Examples**

- *melu* (flow/

passages.name: Goblin Orgasms
passages.content:
On the Reproductive Supremacy of Goblinoids: A Treatise

**Dr. Ignatius Bramblethorne, M.A., D.Phil., F.R.S., Chair of Evolutionary Xenobiology, University of Thuulk**

The learned reader may dismiss as tavern fabrication the accounts of goblin males achieving thirteenâ€”nay, fifteenâ€”climactic emissions in a single rutting session. I assure you, dear colleague, such dismissal would be gravely mistaken. What follows is the fruit of two decades' study, purchased with the virtue of three research assistants (may the Ephemerals grant them peace) and my own haunted nights.

The goblinoid male harbors within his diminutive frame a reproductive apparatus that would humble a prize bull. Beyond the primary testicular sacsâ€”which hang like overripe plums, perpetually swollen with their vile cargoâ€”lie the *glandulae seminalis auxiliares*, a series of walnut-sized chambers nestled against the spine like parasitic tumors. These auxiliary reservoirs churn without cease, brewing a substance so thick with life-force that a single tablespoon, properly deployed, has been observed to impregnate an entire convent of Sisters of Flux (the Westmarch Incident, which the Crown has ordered us never to speak of).

The ejaculate itself defies comparison to human seed, which flows like thin gruel in contrast. Goblin emission emerges in *ropes*â€”and I use this term with disturbing literalnessâ€”of custard-thick matter, warm as fever-flesh and possessed of its own writhing motility. Under lens examination, one observes not the tadpole-like swimmers of human issue, but aggressive, hook-headed things that burrow and claw their way toward their target with disturbing purpose. The consistency varies throughout climax: the initial spurts arrive hot and thick as porridge left too long on the fire, while subsequent emissions grow ever more viscous until the final releases emerge in chewy, pearl-like clots that must be *chewed* by the receiving cavity to break down.

But it is the pheromonal payload that trans

passages.name: Goblish
passages.content:
Goblish

**Professor Angharad Fflur, M.A., M.Litt., Ph.D., F.S.A., Chair of Goblinoid Studies, University of Thuulk**

*From "Comparative Xenolinguistics Quarterly," Vol. XXIII, 1242*

**Prefatory Warning**

What follows is a clinical examination of the most degraded language currently spoken in Zaelasia. I document this filth purely for academic completeness. That the Common tongue has absorbed certain Goblish obscenitiesâ€”"thrack" being the most notoriousâ€”makes this work regrettably necessary.

**Introduction:**

Modern Goblish represents the most catastrophic linguistic devolution ever documented. Where Old Goblin texts reveal complex grammar with seventeen tenses and poetic formations rivaling the Telenil, contemporary Goblish has collapsed into roughly three hundred root words, over two-thirds relating to fornication or violence.

**Phonology:**

The modern goblin throat produces primarily:
- Glottal stops ('k, g'k, kr'k)
- Wet fricatives (particularly when discussing breeding)
- Pharyngeal grunts that accompany most sexual vocabulary

The language sounds, to quote my colleague Dr. Winters, "like someone choking on phlegm while attempting to describe an orgy."

**Grammar:**

Modern Goblish recognizes three tenses:
1. Past: "Grak thrack-uk" (I fucked)
2. Present: "Grak thrack-ik" (I fuck/am fucking)
3. Future: "Grak thrack-ok" (I will fuck)

There is no subjunctive. No conditional. Goblins no longer linguistically conceive of hypotheticals.

**Core Vocabulary:**

*Sexual Terminology:*

The goblins possess forty-three words for ejaculation, each specifying volume, force, and target. Some are derived from old Goblish, whereas many are loanwords or recombinations from the common tongue:
- **"Splurtik"**: To ejaculate weakly (considered insulting)
- **"Grok-splash"**: To ejaculate with sufficient force to impregnate
- **"Thrack-gush"**: To empty one's testicles completely in one coupling
- **"Skeet-uk"**: To ejaculate on a face specifically
- **"Womb-thrack"**: To ej

passages.name: Melka's Lament
passages.content:
Melka's Lament

**Professor Angharad Fflur, M.A., M.Litt., Ph.D., F.S.A., Chair of Goblinoid Studies, University of Thuulk**

*From "Voices from the Vanishing: Last Songs of the Goblin Women" (Thuulk University Press)*

I write this with trembling hand, not from age but from the weight of what I must document. The fragment known as "Melka's Lament"â€”recorded during the extraordinary Thistlecross Encounter between the hero Aldric and the goblin healer Melkaâ€”represents perhaps our final glimpse into authentic female goblinoid erotic-spiritual expression before its inevitable extinction.

The term "Skulgaroth" requires immediate attention. My colleague Dr. Bramblethorne translates it as mere "Deathbringer," but this is criminally reductive. In Old Goblin texts (see my *Codex Viridis*, plates XVII-XXIII), "Skulga" appears not simply as death but as *transformation through ending*â€”the death that births. "Roth" carries dual meaning: both "bringer" and "beloved." Thus Skulgaroth becomes something untranslatable: "Beloved-Who-Brings-The-Death-That-Transforms." That goblin females would name a human male thus speaks to a mythology we have barely begun to comprehend.

The opening lineâ€”*"Groak Aldric Skulgaroth, zu'uka rhaatark lug"*â€”employs the archaic vocative "groak," used exclusively in female goblin religious-erotic verse. This grammatical form died out in male Goblish three generations ago, replaced by the crude "oi" or "grak." That Melka preserves it suggests she learned this song not from her contemporaries but from grandmother-texts, the oral traditions passed between the dying female lines.

Most devastating is the phrase *"z'unn skrizzak"* (I want/need/claim). Modern male Goblish has seventeen words for "want" regarding breeding, all variations of "take" or "mount." But "skrizzak" appears in the *Songs of the Green Mothers* (sadly, mostly destroyed in the Westmarch Purges) as a word meaning "to desire with one's entire genealogy"â€”want that extends backward through on
